itemListElement.name: Leavenworth Village Lights Festival from Seattle with Optional Reindeer Farm

name: Leavenworth Village Lights Festival from Seattle with Optional Reindeer Farm
description: Experience something different this Christmas with transport from Seattle to the picturesque Bavarian village of Leavenworth in the Cascade Mountains. Arrive at the annual, admission-free Village Lighting Festival to browse quaint old-world shops, savor authentic German food from street stands, enjoy live outdoor entertainment, and take a tour of a working Reindeer farm. All day long enjoy the village lights blazing throughout the town in a spectacular display of glittering lights!

review.name: Great option if you don't have a car
review.reviewBody: Excellent driver, comfortable bus, beautiful scenery on the way there, very easy access to the main street of leavenworth, and great timing to spend the day there! My friend and I thought the bus was the perfect option for our day trip needs! We especially appreciated the snacks on the bus ride, movie on the way back, ability to drop off items on the bus (so that we didn't have to carry them the whole day) and having a rest stop on the way there. A couple of suggestions: 1) it appeared that the bus driver and tour guide were not quite on the same page with the itinerary and number of stops, so it would be nice if this were more clear to everyone, including riders, upfront. 2) Although we sincerely appreciated the spirit and cheer of the tour guide, I think that cutting the long list of cheesy jokes and swapping them out for an additional movie (for the way there) would be more enjoyable for everyone on the trip.

name: Tillicum Excursion
description: Myth and magic come to life on the Tillicum Excursion to Blake Island State Park, located 8 miles from Seattle's waterfront. Here, you have the opportunity to learn about the Native American culture, enjoy a delicious buffet featuring traditionally prepared alder fire-roasted fish, and watch a Native American storytelling performance. Take time after the meal and show to explore the beaches and trails that surround Tillicum. This is a trip the whole family will enjoy!

review.name: Above and Beyond Service.
review.reviewBody: My Sister and I took your Cruise today for a day of Adventure. My Sister is restricted to a Scooter, due to a terminal disease. Your employees knew she was in need of assistance, and not 1 but 3 seperate members of the crew were there to literally Push her scooter up and down the ramps. The service was over the top, and I will recommend your tours to all I Know. Thank you all very much for helping me to complete her Bucket list!  Robin Zachary

review.name: Very informative!!
review.reviewBody: Our trip to Tillicum was awesome!! The boat ride over was beautiful.  We learned so much about the Native Americans from the Northwest.  The meal served to us was exceptional!!!  The island was so pretty and peaceful to walk around.  Highly recommend to anyone visiting Seattle.

review.name: Senior group loved Tillicum trip with Argosy
review.reviewBody: I am in charge of a group of Senior volunteers who wanted to go on a day trip for their recognition event. We chose Blake island and was not disappointed. The pier was fairly easy for everyone to find. Parking was right across the street. The boat ride was not too long but not too short. We enjoyed the captains announcements and information about the area. The greeting of hot mugs of Muscles just off the boat was fun. The buffet was delicious. They had headsets with Mandarin interpretation for the performance which we found informative and not too long. My volunteers went on a hike down the beach, which was easily accessible. I thought the gift shop was nice. wide enough isles were helpful. I wish we had another hour on the island. I also thought it would have been nice to know if the local Native Americans were directly benefiting from the proceeds of the trip.

review.name: Very nice trip
review.reviewBody: The cruise to the island was great.  There was an open area on top and an enclosed area on the main level with a bar.  I have a problem with motion sickness, but I took Dramine and sat on the main floor and was fine.  I did not care for the meal, but the majority of our group enjoyed the menu.  An interesting story-telling show followed the meal.  Nice gift shop.

review.name: Fun day on the water and the island
review.reviewBody:
We had a great day on the Tillicum Excursion. The ferry is great, and the driver let my son steer the ferry!  It's a beautiful ride to the island and we saw a lot of sea life. Tillicum Island was fun too. It's was really cool to see the salmon cook and we enjoyed the show. The show was a little shorter than I expected and had a lot of video.  It was interesting, but a little disappointing and short. After the show there's a lot of time (too much time for us) to walk around the small island. 

Overall, we had a fun day!

review.name: First Rate All The Way
review.reviewBody:
Had done this trip with Argosy 2 years ago and decided to do it again. We had my daughter, son in law and their 3 children with us and to a person, we loved it. The boat was large, squeaky clean with an outstanding crew and an excellent tour director (Kelly). They provided an informative narrative of the key sites and history of Puget Sound on the way to Blake Island and pointed out several sea otters and seals on the way as well. Upon arrival, they served a wonderful clam broth with several of those tasty shellfish before entering the longhouse for a delicious salmon dinner. Following dinner the local PNW Native American tribe members put on an educational show of song and dance depicting their culture and the stories of their past. The return trip had wonderful views of the Seattle landscape and luckily Mt. Ranier which is not always visible. 
All in all, a great day thanks to Argosy and the Native American folks.

review.name: History
review.reviewBody:
It was awesome ship, crew and host 5 star adventure. Learned a lot of Chief Seattle and the Indian culture, we are good too🤗
It’s worth every penny and please tip the crew!💵

review.name: Informative and relaxing!
review.reviewBody: I am a Montessori teacher.  I really enjoyed the information given on the ship by the tour guide,  telling us about the history of Blake Island and Seattle.   The dinner was delicious and the performance amazing.  The longhouse was huge.  You could almost see how the Native Americans lived.  Thank you for a lovely experience!

review.name: Stunning trip
review.reviewBody:
Took this trip as part of a package from the cruise we were on. The boat left on time to the island, and upon arrival we were given a mug of clams. We were ushered into the main building and there we were fed and watered. The food was amazing, a selection of cooked meats and fish with rice, along with a peach cobbler pudding, all washed down with coffee. The show that we watched was interesting, and then we were allowed to walk around the island before the boat back to Seattle.
Overall a well run trip, the staff were professional and knowledgeable. 
Well done

review.name: we had to cancel see below
review.reviewBody: We could not make the trip because the ferry from Southworth to Seattle was full. We called and it was rescheduled for 09/15. where are our tickets

itemListElement.name: Victoria, BC Roundtrip Ferry Day Trip

name: Victoria, BC Roundtrip Ferry Day Trip
description: Taking a day trip from Seattle to Victoria, British Columbia, in Canada has never been easier, or more beautiful. Explore the beautiful town of Victoria on the Victoria Clipper V fast ferry, leaving from downtown Seattle at Pier 69. The high-speed Victoria Clipper V will take you on a relaxing 3-hour cruise through the Puget Sound to Victoria’s Inner Harbor. This passenger-only ferry features a host of great amenities, including comfortable seats, an onboard duty-free gift shop and locally-sourced food and beverages available for purchase.

review.name: Cancelled
review.reviewBody: Me and my family were excited to be going to Canada and I get a Email stating your trip canceled.  I did ask why on the text app they have but never got a response. I understand things happen but at least communicate something. If your booking tho trip be prepared for disappointment one day prior to your trip.

review.name: Trip to Victoria
review.reviewBody: All of the staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. For some reason, we were not assigned seats when I booked the trip and we had to see the attendant to get our seats. She made sure that we sat together and were seated in a very good spot. We decided we wanted to do high tea at the Empress hotel so they went ahead and booked our reservation for us. They were very attentive and made sure that we had drinks, food, and we’re comfortable. The whole trip was very seamless and I highly recommend it.

review.name: Wonderful Day Out
review.reviewBody: We booked this well in advance from the UK via the website. We had read some reviews that were not so good about boats not sailing due to weather problems and staff being unsympathetic to the loss of the fare.  We found none of this it was Great! The process of boarding, border control etc was all fine. Staff courteous and professional. The Clipper V Boat was clean, tidy and comfortable. The booking conditions are clear, its non refundable if boat cannot go out in bad weather, that's the chance you take booking in advance.  Its a 3 hour trip and the scenery is tremendous.  Not cheap but a really good day out; a great opportunity to sample a bit of Canada.

review.name: Day trip to Victoria B.C.
review.reviewBody: Comfortable ride. Easy to navigate the boarding process. The ferry ride added to the fun of our day trip/adventure. Highly recommend.

review.name: Wonderful
review.reviewBody: Trip was great. Staff was overly helpful as we were traveling with a walker. Recommended the excursion that best suited our needs in Victoria.

review.name: Frustrated
review.reviewBody: We missed our ferry back home. The coast guard told us the ferry is going back at 8:30PM, but when we arrived at the ferry around 6:50PM it is already closed.  And also the Clipper crew should announce what time will they go back to Seattle.  We should deserve a refund from that trip ( August 19, 2024). We have a same day round trip.

review.name: Missed opportunity
review.reviewBody: Emily sold us a tour to Butchart Gardens and told us we needed to take the 3 pm so we didn’t miss the return trip. When we got back found out the clipper did not leave until 7pm. On the future you might want the staff to know the schedule

review.name: Full Day Trip to Victoria on Thursdays doesn’t exist
review.reviewBody: We did not go on the day trip to Victoria because the only return trip on Thursdays is at 1:30, leaving only 1/2 hour of time to visit Victoria.  We are requesting a refund of our day trip.

review.name: One day getaway to Victoria
review.reviewBody: Comfortable seating. Good breakfast food options. Wonderful crew/customer service.Our Alaska cruise was scheduled to make a 4 hour stop in Victoria on our last night from 8pm to midnight. But we wanted to really experience Victoria, so we booked this day trip the day before our cruise began.

review.name: STRANDED IN VICTORIA WITH NO WAY HOME // cancelled return trip 6/8/24
review.reviewBody:
Approximately one month ago, my mother and I embarked on a trip to Victoria, BC for a weekend getaway, only to find ourselves abandoned by the FRS Clipper. Despite the enjoyable time spent in Victoria itself, the entire experience was ruined by the utter failure of the FRS Clipper team to communicate effectively and take responsibility for stranding us. The night before our scheduled return, our hotel displayed a Victoria Clipper advisory indicating a sailing advisory was in effect. The concierge vaguely mentioned technical issues without providing further details, raising immediate concerns. We hoped these would be resolved by morning.

Regrettably, they were not. At 9:30 AM, hours before our scheduled 6 PM departure, my mother received an email (which apparently not all passengers received) informing us that our return trip was canceled. Shockingly, the email offered no alternatives for getting back to Seattle, focusing solely on only refunding the boat fare. Consequently, our final vacation day was consumed by stress and wasted time as we scrambled to find a way home. We even had a high-tea reservation at the Empress that was also tainted, since we spent the entire hour looking at viable options to get home.

Ultimately, the most direct and less time consuming option we found was an $800 flight back to Seattle, plus the additional expense of an Uber to reach Victoria Airport. Upon our return, our attempts to engage with FRS Clipper for empathy or accountability were met with further disappointment. The company showed no willingness to reimburse us or any other affected customers for the substantial extra costs incurred due to their cancellation. Had the initial email from the Clipper provided viable return options (such as bus routes, ferry alternatives, etc.), we could have salvaged the remainder of our trip and adjusted our plans accordingly. Once again, the flagrant lack of accountability, communication, and customer service displayed by this company was utterly disgraceful.

While Victoria remains a charming destination, I strongly advise exploring alternative travel methods such as driving, or carefully considering other routes. Otherwise, you risk being stranded and forced to shell out hundreds of dollars unexpectedly—funds that could have been better spent elsewhere.

itemListElement.name: Seattle in One Day: Sightseeing Tour including Space Needle and Pike Place Market

name: Seattle in One Day: Sightseeing Tour including Space Needle and Pike Place Market
description: Not sure what to see in Seattle? Take the stress out of sightseeing on this 5-hour tour, which covers 50 miles (80 kilometers) of downtown Seattle and the city’s beautiful surrounding neighborhoods. Enjoy two hours of free time at Pike Place Market and conclude your tour at the Space Needle (admission included). Plus, see dozens of other places that make Seattle special – the Ballard Locks, Safeco Field, Fremont, Chinatown and much more! Keep your eyes open for some of Seattle’s famous views too, including those of the Cascades, Mt. Rainier and Puget Sound.

review.name: Excellent!
review.reviewBody: Excellent way to get to see the beautiful city of Seattle. 3 hours is just about the right amount of time.

review.name: Excellent experience
review.reviewBody: This was the best way to see Seattle with out running around on your own. The driver was very informative even had flash card to show us how it looked in the passed compared to how it looks now. We had enough time at the pike place to see and eat. It all ends at the space needle. Enjoyed this experience very well. I highly recommend this tour. It seems long but the driver makes it so much fun, that time flies by.

review.name: Great way to learn where to go and what to do
review.reviewBody: I really enjoyed the Seattle tour.  I knew nothing about Seattle so it was a great way to learn about the events, activities, etc.  If not for the tour, I would have missed the gum wall!

review.name: Lovely scenic tour!!
review.reviewBody: A pleasant outing.  The tour group was very small, which was good.  A nice size were your questions can be answered with a 'one on one feeling' to it. We were given some decent opportunities to take some breathtaking pictures.  Enjoyable.

review.name: Excellent introduction to Seattle
review.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed this introductory tour of Seattle. Ken, our tour guide was interesting and informative and mentioned that he had become a guide after a change of career. We saw a lot of the popular locations but also enjoyed the tour to a less well known and grittier area of the city. Ken’s attention to detail and amusing anecdotes kept our attention. This tour is well worth doing to inform and amuse visitors.

review.name: Lance is excellent
review.reviewBody:
Tour Guide Lance is excellent at his job.  He is a font of local knowledge.  

We had just three couples, which was nice.  Because we had such a small group, perhaps we could have been given more time at Pioneer Square.  We had about five minutes inside the Glasshouse Studio, then we had to walk quickly to the Klondike in order to use their restrooms, public restrooms which Lance assured us were clean.  (They were.)  That took the entire 15 minutes, so we had to rush back to the bus.  No other stops were rushed.

The tour showed us Pike Street Market, downtown, a working marina, the Fish Ladder at Chittendam Locks, Ballard, lots of architecture, lots of foliage, a real estate tour of Queens-something, some vista points, etc.  

As promised, we were given two hours on our own at Pike Street Market.  Based on Lance's recommendation (just one of many), Maximillan's sounded good.  However, we were seated with my back to the window, at a small two-top.  There was little atmosphere.  What there was was snooty.  Nothing on the menu struck our fancy, so we left and had lunch at Lowell's.  It was, for us, a much better option.  One couple did dine at Maximillan's.  The third couple, like us, were seated, reviewed the menu and left.  

As part of the tour, we were given reusable grocery bags and discount coupons, as well as a map of Seattle.  We used one of the discount coupons at Confectional.  The coupons are nice but would be nicer if more information were provided on each coupon -- What is this for?  Something free?  Dollars off?  What?  Which item?

The tour was scheduled for five hours.  It may have run longer.  We were to be dropped at the Space Needle.  Lance gave each of us a pre-paid ticket to the Space Needle.  By then, we were ready for a nap, so Lance dropped us at our downtown hotel.

The 'coach' was very comfortable.

There is a sign that says tips are appreciated.  That's fine.  BUT the sign suggests 10 - 20% of the ticket price.  We paid $300 for the two of us.  A 20% tip would be another $60.  I think that's a VERY BIG tip; after all, a tip is extra income to the Tour Guide, it's not his salary.  We tipped 10%, or $30.

I highly recommend this tour.  I suggest you do it on your first day.  It'l help you decide how you want to spend the remainder of your visit, what places you want to return to, etc.

review.name: Seattle in a Day
review.reviewBody: This was a great tour, it was different than the video showed, but not by much and our driver was great!

review.name: Awesome
review.reviewBody: Had the best time. From someone who only had a day in Seattle this was the best route for me! Tour guide was very knowledgable.

review.name: Great Tour!!
review.reviewBody: Tour guide was friendly and very knowledgeable. We highly recommend tour if you want to get to know Seattle.

review.name: Great One day Seattle tour
review.reviewBody: visiting from out of town and wanted to get an overview of Seattle.this definitely fit the bill. Bryan was a great, knowledgeable tour guide who made the tour fun and interesting. would highly recommend!!

name: Boeing Factory Tour from Seattle
description: If you're amazed by flying and airplanes, this is an essential experience! Tour the factory where they build and test the famous Boeing aircraft, the world's number one aerospace company. During this 4.5 hour small-group tour, you start off with a complimentary hotel pickup and depart for Mukilteo from downtown Seattle. Spend 1.5 hours inside the impressive Boeing factory on a tour that showcases the magnificent 747, 777, 787 aircraft used worldwide and the Dreamliner which is currently in production, all housed here in the world's largest building! Finish your day exploring the Boeing Future of Flight and Boeing gift shop before heading back to Seattle.

review.name: Injury
review.reviewBody: Be careful if you get injured they will not even pay your medical bills. Even when the entry is their faught.

review.name: fascinating
review.reviewBody: We thoroughly enjoyed our tour of the Boeing factory. Our driver/guide was super informative and a great driver. The tour at Boeing was unbelievable. It is an amazing set up, the scale of which is hard to imagine. Well worth the money and would definitely recommend.

review.name: A great tourist activity and experience
review.reviewBody:
The Boeing Factory is the largest assembly building in the world. The tour involves:
* A guided bus and walking tour of the factory, including viewing a number of aircraft assembly lines
* The visitor centre, including a museum, airport viewing platform and shop

If you can make your own way to Everitt, the price is under USD$30. A number of operators provide tours from Seattle. In my case, I used Tours Northwest . The driver and guide was an ex-Boeing employee and provided a very knowledgeable commentary of our trip up from Seattle and background before we took the Boeing tour itself.

review.name: Worthwhile experience
review.reviewBody: It’s a pain to get there but it’s a great experience. Learnt a lot about Boeing and saw some amazing planes being made. Wld also recommend going to the Museum of Flight. If I had to choose between the 2, I’d prioritise Muesum of Flight over this though this tour is also very worth it. Just a pain to get there but it can be done by public transport.

review.name: Learned that Boeing is more than just airplanes
review.reviewBody: Very cool to see airplanes being assembled.  Future of Flight was interesting as we did not really know much about Boeing's drone, person vehicle, and submarine businesses.  Also did not realize how much they are involved with space travel and the international space station.  All guides excellent!

review.name: great
review.reviewBody: did the tour with a pickup in Seattle and the driver was excellent. worth both the time and money a must....

review.name: Great tour guide, OK Boeing tour
review.reviewBody: I booked the tour because I’m traveling solo and would like to have convenient transportation. Although the tour is all about Boeing and Boeing has their own employees to lead the tour, our tour guide shared a lot of interesting details about Seattle, like tour tips, dining, history, culture, housing prices and so on. He also offered to drop us to places we would like to be after the tour and gave us extra tips about exploring the places we got off. As for the Boeing tour, I think the tour didn’t give us enough time to explore things and ask questions. We just went up to the 4 viewing points on the top floor and looked at people working on parts of planes while the Boeing employee gave a very brief introduction of what they were doing. You are not allowed to take your phone in there so no pictures inside. There is a small exhibition in the lobby of the factory tour which is interesting. You can design your own plane and test fly it. You can also fly with a lead bird and learn about how birds are flying. This exhibition is worth a look.

review.name: Fascinating insight to Boeing
review.reviewBody: We were collected from our hotel in Seattle and as it was out of season there were only 5 of us on the tour bus. Our driver was interesting and spoke to us about the history of Boeing on the way. There were no safety belts on our mini coach and I felt uncomfortable travelling at speed on the freeway-I was surprised that this was allowed in the USA.  At Boeing it was quiet and we had a coffee before putting ALL our belongings in a locker.  A coach takes you to the building and you are shown to 2 areas in a group where you can watch the planes being assembled. It was very interesting but you spend much less time there than I expected.  The tour itself does take 90 minutes but you only spend about 30minutes actually watching the plane assembly areas.  It is really fascinating if you like planes and I am glad that we went, but I did expect to spend more time actually seeing the planes and less time being driven and walked about.

review.name: Excellent Tour and Great Guide
review.reviewBody: Punctuality, promptly pick up. Very useful feedback related to what to visit in the city of Seattle and how to approach the local community.

review.name: Great tour and guide
review.reviewBody: Tyler was knowledgable and interesting. He also knew when not to talk. Boeing factory was a must see.

itemListElement.name: Seattle Combo Tour: City Tour, Pike Place Market and Boeing Factory

name: Seattle Combo Tour: City Tour, Pike Place Market and Boeing Factory
description: See Seattle’s essential sights in one fun, busy day on this 9-hour adventure that includes a city tour, time at Pike Place Market and a trip to the Boeing factory. Start with a city sightseeing tour of top attractions like the Space Needle, Pioneer Square, Lake Union and the Ballard Locks. Then enjoy up to 90 minutes of free time at Pike Place Market to explore and buy lunch, and end the day with a tour of Boeing’s assembly plant and Boeing Future of Flight. Hotel pickup and drop-off is included for most downtown Seattle hotels.

review.name: Day in Seattle
review.reviewBody: We enjoyed the tour with Daniel he was so knowledgeable about everything and had a great sense of humor. We did so much. We were short on time so this was perfect.

review.name: Wonderful host and driver-Jeff
review.reviewBody: We had a very knowledgeable and friendly driver. Good tour and glad we did it on a Saturday because of traffic being lighter

review.name: Excellent tour
review.reviewBody: We only had 2 days in Seattle and needed a good tour that would show us the city and give us some tips of what further to see.  It was a comprehensive tour and Gary was a great guide.  The Boeing factory tour was amazing and well worth the visit.  Highly recommended.

review.name: Tour of the city of Seattle
review.reviewBody: The tour was very well planned and executed, the high light of the tour was the Boeing factory although there were many other interesting places seen.

review.name: Almost Perfect
review.reviewBody:
This was one of the better tours I have ever taken. Ken was an excellent tour guide and gave in-depth information on the sights and sounds of Seattle in the surrounding cities. 

On the downside, I feel that the company can do a better job at identifying areas for breaks and/or creating a different schedule that allows more time at the Space Needle.  There was a couple stops and at least one neighborhood that could have, in my opinion, been skipped. This coupled with trimming maybe 30 minutes off Pikes Place Market would allow about an hour for the Space Needle. 

 Even if the price were increased, THAT would make this the perfect tour.

review.name: Great tour with fun guide
review.reviewBody: Doug was our guide and he was fun and entertaining the whole trip. Doug was knowledgeable and attentive. The tour was worth the money.

review.name: Excellent Value!
review.reviewBody: Ken, our driver, was prompt, knowledgeable, and provided great insight.  We only had one day to experience Seattle and visit the Boeing Factory.  The route was well planned with rest room and food breaks.  We highly recommend this tour and tour guide Ken!

review.name: Enjoyed the city tour, saw the highlights so we'd know where we'd like to spend more time.
review.reviewBody: Our driver was excellent, with humor and insight all along the way. The pick up and drop off at our hotel was quick and easy. The city tour provided us a good overview of info and where we wanted to return to visit the next day. The time at the different stops was appropriate. Just right for us! It is so much better for us to let a competent driver share the sites with us instead of us trying to manage traffic, parking and seeing all that is around us as we drive the area. At Boeing, the tour was very interesting, and we got to see the amazing operations in that huge building. Highly recommend this tour and this company.

review.name: Seattle city tour and Boeing tour.
review.reviewBody:
Ken our tour bus guide was great. Learned a lot about the Seattle. 
Pikes market was interesting to see.
Boeing tour was very rushed. Thought we would see more in the factory and be shown more of the building process.

review.name: Fantastic Day!
review.reviewBody: What a great day, Tim our tour guide was terrific!  He was informative and entertaining, the day flew by.

itemListElement.name: Mt. Rainier Day Tour from Seattle

name: Mt. Rainier Day Tour from Seattle
description:
Visit Mt. Rainier with our professional, enthusiastic and informative tour guides. Travel in our clean, comfortable 22-passenger mini-coaches with large windows, high back seats and air-conditioning.

Experience old-growth forests, wildflower-filled meadows, and thundering waterfalls on this tour of glacier-clad Mt. Rainier. Hike and walk a little or not at all: there are options for all abilities. Enjoy lunch at a Mt. Rainier cafe or buy a picnic lunch along the way. Visit the interpretive center at Paradise or Sunrise to learn even more about the mountain’s glaciers, plants and animals.

Return to Seattle through pastoral farmlands and memorable Pacific Northwest scenery. Bring a camera on this spectacular Mt. Rainier tour as well as comfortable walking shoes. Layer both warm and cool weather clothing as mountain temperatures can vary from rainy and cold to sunny and hot during a single day.

review.name: Beautiful Tour
review.reviewBody: Me and my husband did this tour while on our honeymoon. We went from Seattle and I’m so glad we did! Ron was a great guide and so knowledgeable. We saw so much in 1 day, by the end of the day, everyone on the bus was knocked out on the two hour ride back. Thats how you know it was a good day!

review.name: Great experience, highly recommend
review.reviewBody:
Super fun and highly recommend. 
Our guide John was very knowledgeable and provided great insights not only in the park, but also on the drive to it. As a bonus, he had snowshoes for us to use on one of our hikes. 
Will tell everyone I know looking for a day trip to do this tour.

review.name: Beautiful Day Trip!
review.reviewBody:
This trip was well worth it and so much fun! Our guide John was knowledgeable about so many things, and it was a beautiful day for a visit. We ran into a hiccup with our food stop, but John was adaptable and was always in a good mood and found the group an alternative. 

The views were amazing! John took us to the best spots especially for pictures. Overall, we loved this day trip for our anniversary. Highly recommend it!

review.name: Informational, scenic, and comfortable
review.reviewBody: Our tour guide John was friendly and fun. He was extremely informative, brought us to the best sights, and was aware of the weather and planned accordingly. It was an amazing experience!

review.name: Great tour!!!
review.reviewBody: We were visiting Seattle for the weekend and decided to take the day trip to Mt. Rainier. One of the best day tour and worth the the trip. it was perfect weather and serene atmosphere. Our guide and driver John was so knowledgeable, joyful and took us to all the great spots. Would highly recommend this tour to anyone on a short trip to Seattle.

review.name: Girls’ Trip Fun
review.reviewBody: Erika was fabulous!!!!   She took us to several waterfalls.  She made sure everyone was taken care of.  We got snowed on and lots of clouds over the tops of the mountains but Rainier finally was revealed before we left.

review.name: South Carolina Girls
review.reviewBody: John was awesome! He explained everything to us.  Was super helpful.  Took pics with us and went through the entire mountain tour with us.  He was funny on bus with lots of personality

review.name: It was  a great trip to My Rainier
review.reviewBody: The views were amazing. Gary was very knowledgeable and courteous. He had a great sense of humor.  Gary was very respectful

review.name: Don’t like hiking? Do this tour
review.reviewBody: Even if you don’t like hiking, you should do this tour. You get to see Mt. Rainier from different points of views, among other amazing areas, like lakes, waterfalls and big old trees. John was our tour guide, amazing, knowledgeable and helpful guide. 100% recommended!!!!

review.name: Amazing Mt. Rainier day trip from Seattle (Bus Tour)! 10/10 _ By Tours by Northwest
review.reviewBody:
Mt. Rainier - August 2024
I had one of the best day trips with Tours Northwest. Our Tour guide Mark was excellent, kind, professional and very knowledgeable about the historical backgrounds of the sights we visited. Mt. Rainier hiking was one of my bucket lists and I couldn't have chosen the best tour bus and the best day tour from Seattle! Mark , our tour guide went above and beyond stopping at beautiful must see spots  and offered to take pictures of every passenger who wanted to capture the moments. We accomplished so much and were able to visit multiple hiking trails, historical rivers and water falls like Ohanapecosh and historical trees that are hundreds of years old. We also had the opportunity to stop by for ice-cream at Elbe Market for the famous huckleberry ice-cream. Best experience ever! 10/10 recommend!

itemListElement.name: Best of Mount Rainier National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour

name: Best of Mount Rainier National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour
description:
No two tours with Evergreen Escapes are the same! Our guides craft itineraries that reflect the best of what the Park has to offer that day, including group interests and dynamics. Please note that the itinerary outlined is a SAMPLE of potential destinations that could be included in the tour.

Experience Mount Rainier's highlights on a day tailored to you. Our TripAdvisor "Hall of Fame" guides run the only day tours permitted to explore more than a mile from the park road as the National Park is ecologically important & delicate. The U.S. Park Service restricts other tour companies - our competitors offer "road tours." We are professional nature educators (not just bus drivers) that have dedicated our lives to artful travel.

Our all-inclusive small-group day trip is limited to just 10 travelers.

review.name: WOW
review.reviewBody: Had an absolutely amazing day. This was my first time snow shoeing. Jackie and Connor made me feel safe and secure at all times. The food was lovely and filled us up on the energy we needed. Had loads of WOW moments. Would highly recommend :)

review.name: Great experience
review.reviewBody: Brent was great! It was a great experience! I snowshoed for the first time too. They also picked me up from my hotel so I didn’t have to drive anywhere.

review.name: Amazing Mount Rainier Day Trip
review.reviewBody: I had an incredible experience on the Mount Rainier day trip excursion! I learned so much. Traveling solo I was a little nervous but the guide helped me feel completely at ease and comfortable throughout. All the details were so well planned and executed: punctuality, safety, adapting to unpredictable weather and individual needs of guests. So glad I went on this trip! Thank you!

review.name: Great Experience
review.reviewBody: This was a wonderful way to experience the natural beauty of Mount Rainer and the surrounding area. I was staying downtown, with no car and found the pick up option to be extremely convenient. Our tour guide was wonderful! I couldn’t have asked for a better group to jump into solo and explore with. The food provided was delicious, everyone kept commenting on how good it was. I would absolutely recommend this tour.

review.name: Loved it!
review.reviewBody: I cannot recommend this tour enough! Brent was fantastic and provided excellent paths and knowledge throughout the guide. Booking was easy, equipment for snowshoeing was provided, and snacks throughout the trip. Your tour guide also picks/drops you off and sets up drinks and lunch.  My only recommendation would be to change up the lunch or bring your own if you're on the picky side!

review.name: Best tour we've been on
review.reviewBody:
I can't say enough good things about this tour -- by far the best we've ever been on!
It definitely helps that the weather was perfect, and we could see Mt. Rainier all day - at every stop!  
Our tour guide, Brent, was excellent!  He gave us plenty of information but kept it interactive and curbed it to the interests of the group.  He didn't lecture, and there wasn't a single time during the trip I wish I brought head phones to tune him out (like other tours) :)
We had a young, fun group, which also helped.  We were able to hike quite a few trails, and see tons of breathtaking views.
This was the highlight of our 8 day vacation - both of our favorite part!  
Thanks Brent and our new friends from the tour for an unforgettable experience -- it was perfect!

review.name: Magical Snow with amazing waterfalls
review.reviewBody: Amazing trip with a great tour group and a knowledgeable guide Marty for the day to Mount Rainier. We encountered snow, some rain, saw breathtaking waterfalls and hiked in the snow. Thanks to Marty for the tips on how to navigate the slippery slopes at times when I doubted if I could do it without falling down. The walks needed a bit of stamina but it was all worthwhile. Lunch was delicious and so happy to have this wonderful trip. Thank you!

review.name: great day tour
review.reviewBody: Marty guided our  small group on the last really sunny fall day -- before the snow arrived a couple of days later with the cold weather. We had a lovely day with this very  experienced guide who ensured we saw the best parts of the park before  the roads closed for the winter season. Highly recommended for a day tip from Seattle.

review.name: Amazing option to explore more of Washington
review.reviewBody:
A fantastic trip thanks to Kayla on the busiest day of the park in 2024. 

She made sure the time flyby with the long traffic jam getting into the park, and more important never felt rushed inside the park and even offered to stay longer in the park to mark up for the time lost earlier that morning.

Stunning fall day with views to the mountain all day, a  breakfast with a view, lunch was very delicious and the drinks and snacks were a great selection. Best bit the surprise after the last hike.

We might have lucked out with the wildlife because how late in the season and how busy it was, but Kayla was super knowledgeable about the NP, the fauna and wildlife and we got the best view

review.name: Recommend any tour with Evergreen Escapes and especially Matthew as your guide.
review.reviewBody:
We went on the Mt Rainier Trip. We had Matthew as our guide.  My wife and I really enjoyed the trip, Matthew was very knowledgeable about all the plants and animals. We saw parts of the old mountain forest. Matthew was able to bring the Forest to life for us with his expertise and knowledge. He was able to provide the history about the area as well about the current plants, trees and animals.  He showed us variety of berries, flowers, mushrooms, birds and chipmunks. He showed off the old hot springs and rust springs (from the iron in the water).  Very entertaining, very inclusive, providing great enjoyment for our whole group.  I would defiantly recommend any tour with Evergreen Escapes and especially Matthew as your guide.  I would give him six stars instead of five he was that good and knowledgeable. My wife and I went on three different trips while we were visiting Seattle and his Mt Rainier guided tour was the best of our trips by far.  If you want a great tour, I would pick Evergreen Escapes they have great guides. Hopefully you will get on a tour with Matthew as your guide and you will learn a lot.
He went out of his way to try to get us a good picture of the summit which was hiding in the clouds the day we went.  But by the end of the day, we finally got that whole Mt Rainier picture. The clouds cleared and we got some good pictures. They provided coffee, tea and water. Great snacks, a good lunch and good deserts. We started off with French pressed coffee and flavored bread. Our whole group enjoyed the tour. My Wife and I really had fun and think anyone booking this will have fun too. Six Stars (I guess I can live with 5 stars). We even got some pictures of the wild Elk.  I would defiantly recommend this tour.

mainEntity.name: How do I arrange pickup for the Best of Mount Rainier National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: We offer complimentary pick-up and drop-off wherever you’re staying in downtown Seattle – hotels, Airbnbs, vacation rentals, a private home, etc. Our operations team will connect with you 24 hours prior to your trip to confirm the time and location.

mainEntity.name: What should I wear for the Best of Mount Rainier National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: Please wear closed-toe comfortable walking shoes, hiking shoes, or boots and bring a light wind/waterproof jacket. We also recommend dressing in layers, with a non-cotton outer layer (please avoid denim).

mainEntity.name: What should I bring with me on the Best of Mount Rainier National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: A hat and sunglasses are great. Also, your cell phone or camera and any necessary medications are pretty much it! We're happy to take care of everything else!

mainEntity.name: Do you have vegetarian options on the Best of Mount Rainier National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes - Please be sure to enter in any special needs/requests in the "Special Requirements" box at checkout and we will do our best to accommodate you!

mainEntity.name: How strenuous is the Best of Mount Rainier National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: We have built our trips to appeal to all abilities and interest levels, and are rated easy to moderate. Our tours have a maximum of ten guests, which allows your guide to tailor the activity level to your group.

mainEntity.name: What happens if it rains on the day of my Best of Mount Rainier National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: Our guides craft the best itinerary to accommodate the weather. We run our tours rain or shine because the Pacific Northwest is stunning regardless of the weather. Frequently, wet weather only lasts an hour or so before things start to improve again!

itemListElement.name: Private Departure Transfer to Seattle Tacoma Airport SEA

name: Private Departure Transfer to Seattle Tacoma Airport SEA
description:
Why stress waiting for unreliable taxis or shuttle transfers to Seattle Tacoma Airport? Ensure peace of mind with a private transfer from your downtown Seattle, Bellevue or Kirkland accommodation to Seattle Tacoma Airport (SEA). Reach the airport relaxed and with plenty of time before your flight!

Transfer services are available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Choose from a luxury sedan transfer for three people, a sport utility vehicle transfer or van that carries up to five passengers! All vehicles feature stylish and spacious interiors and you will be met and escorted by a professional chauffeur.

review.name: Judy
review.reviewBody: It was a very good experience and the Driver was very efficient. Knew exactly where to take us and got us there in plenty of time.

name: Seattle Highlights Sightseeing Tour
description: Pair pop culture with history during this 1.5-hour sightseeing tour of Seattle by minibus. Drive by city highlights like Pike Place Market, Pioneer Square and the Space Needle, and snap pics of the floating house from ‘Sleepless in Seattle’ and Kurt Cobain’s former home. Greet a troll under a bridge and disembark for photo ops. With grunge music playing in the background, listen to entertaining anecdotes from a guide along the way. Hotel pickup is included for customers staying at downtown Seattle hotels, South Lake Union area hotels, or university area hotels.

review.name: Excellent Tour
review.reviewBody: This tour was an excellent way to get to know Seattle.  Furthermore, Charles did a great job as our tour guide.  He has a true passion for Seattle and his tours.

review.name: Cruzin with Chuck
review.reviewBody: Chuck the Chuckster is an absolute blast !   From the boarding until depart it was a fun , informative, and just a good time .  Sheila and I will mark this two hours as one of the Seattle highlights . We seen places and things only a local would know about and more important how to great there .   Would recommend do this trip as soon as you get to town it will help you get your bearings.   Chuck like how I slipped in that nautical term ?   Now you ask him why I would do that !      Bob and Sheila , Milton ,Florida

review.name: Great kick off to our Seattle vacation!
review.reviewBody: Chuck was great!! He picked us up, gave us a tour run down, and away we went. Funny, fun, and informative, we learned a lot, saw a lot, and got some fantastic photos to prove it! We lucked out with some crystal clear weather, and at the end he dropped us off at the aquarium to continue our afternoon adventures! I 100% recommend :))

review.name: Seattle quick tour
review.reviewBody: Chuck aka "The Chuckster"  was a super eccentric guy! He's definitely full on energy and corny jokes lol We really enjoyed this tour and the experience. I learned a lot! My only regret is that we didn't take the tour the first day of our stay. We could have used some of his helpful tips to save money sooner.

review.name: Seattle Highlights Tour
review.reviewBody:
If you only have a little time to explore Seattle,I definitely recommend the Seattle Highlighrs tour. We had the Chuckster and he really is entertaining and knows Seattle inside and out. He picked us up at our hotel and spent every minute making sure we saw Seattle and it’s highlights. 
It was awesome .  Definitely a must do when in Seattle.

review.name: Get ready to laugh!!
review.reviewBody: This tour was great. Chuckles (tour guide) had us laughing the entire time! Great vibe, great tour and even better he picks you up from your hotel. Highly recommended.  But get ready to laugh!!

review.name: Highly Recommend !
review.reviewBody: What a great time! Informative and fun. A good mixture of vistas, geography, pop culture, history and humor. Chuck is a energetic and genuine nice guy!  He quickly gets to know his quests and tailor's his tour to make it as enjoyable as possible for all. This is our second Qwik tour with Chuck. Highly recommend!

review.name: On vacation.
review.reviewBody:
My wife and I have been on many city tours around the country. This one by far is one of, if not the best one we have been on. Chuck (The Chuckster) was non stop high energy from the beginning to the end of the tour. He is obviously very proud of his city and loves sharing it through his knowledge of Seattle.
 Great value. I would highly recommend this tour.

review.name: Seattle 1.5hr Qwik tour
review.reviewBody:
Loved it!  The Chuckster showed us sites & neighborhoods of Seattle while entertaining us with stories, facts & jokes.  The time flew by while we got to view the highlights of Seattle.  Perfect city tour!!
Thank you, Chuck!

review.name: Funny and timely
review.reviewBody: My husband and I had limited time in the city, and we loved the 90 minute tour.  Chuckster is a funny and informative tour guide.  I appreciated his love for the city and willingness to show us as much as possible in 90 minutes that are even a little off the beaten path.  This is an excellent tour for tweens/teens and older.  The tour bus was clean and in good shape. We felt very secure and comfortable on the tour.  This is a great way to see the city.

itemListElement.name: Lake Union Seaplane Flight From Seattle

name: Lake Union Seaplane Flight From Seattle
description: See the sights of Seattle during a 20-minute flight in a 5- or 10-passenger seaplane. Everyone gets a window seat on this flightseeing tour over Seattle’s waterfront areas that provides you with aerial views of the Space Needle, Lake Union, professional sports stadiums and the downtown skyline. Listen to music and recorded commentary about the city, and end with a picture perfect water landing in the heart of the city.

review.name: Convenient, Fun and Great Views
review.reviewBody:
Fun way to get from Seattle to Victoria.

The plane held 7 people, plus the pilot.  It left from Lake Union in downtown Seattle and landed in Victoria Harbor.  

Boarding was simple.  The only unexpected thing was the weight restrictions on luggage.  I had a roller board and a backpack (37 lbs)  they charge $1 per pound over 25lbs.

The trip took 40 minutes and the views were awesome.  I would totally do it again.

review.name: Superb Customer Service
review.reviewBody:
I bought my other half a gift voucher with Kenmore Air for Christmas 2021, because we were spending the holiday with our family in Seattle.  Unfortunately snow stopped play and we couldn't take advantage of the voucher; but Kenmore honour their vouchers, which never go out of date, so we were able to use it on our second trip this spring.

We did originally book to fly back from San Juan Island but, again, the weather was against us and, although Kenmore were happy to transfer us to a standard, rather than seaplane, flight, my other half really wanted to experience a seaplane, or float plane as they seem to be called here.

Kenmore quickly refunded us our San Juan flight costs and we went in to rebook.

At this stage, I should say that if you are interested in planes, then a personal visit to the headquarters in Kenmore is well worth it.  Hangers where work is being carried out, a lovely admin building, with small shop containing - you've guessed it - flight related gifts and souvenirs, and just so many beautiful planes both out of and on the water.

The lovely girls on Reception helped us choose another flight and we went for the scenic flight around Seattle, leaving from their base on Union Lake.  Easy to get to via public transport and, again, a good space with a more limited shop, waiting room, restrooms etc.

Our pilot Brian was good humoured and friendly (happy to pose for pictures afterwards) and we were fortunate to just have ourselves and one other couple on board.  We donned headphones, which had a running commentary on them, as we flew around Seattle, seeing all the major landmarks.

This was a bucket list experience for both of us, so it was always going to be a real thrill and I am quite unashamed in waxing lyrical about it.

However, the professionalism and efficiency of Kenmore, their willingness and determination to help us fulfil our dream cannot be underestimated and was much appreciated.

review.name: SEA to VIC 2007
review.reviewBody: Fun, Exciting Beautiful experience I will never forget. Flying over Elliot Bay, up Puget Sound and landing in Victoria bay by the Empress is the experience of a lifetime.

review.name: Breathtaking Views
review.reviewBody:
Highly recommend. Great to do with teenagers.  No better way to tour Seattle!
Staff was very friendly and efficient.

review.name: Wheee!
review.reviewBody: Really smooth takeoff and landing. Amazing views over Seattle. Commentary was taped and could have been a little more informative and accurate to the point of flight. Still a great experience. You need to know your weight accurately!

review.name: Crazy cool!
review.reviewBody: This was a great experience! My wife and I have never been in a small plane, we fly a lot for business and have been in helicopters before, but this was something new. The take off was extremely quick, and the landing was super smooth. We did the 20 minute tour and actually was very informative and felt like a decent amount of time. We flew right passed the Space-needle , and it seemed strange to be eye level with the visitors inside!

review.name: Just wow
review.reviewBody: I’d like to start by saying that flying in airplane has always made me nervous. I have never enjoyed flying. That changed today. My sister and I took a Seaplane with Kenmore Air from Seattle/Lake Union to Friday Harbor and back. This experience really made our trip memorable! Pilots made us feel safe and comfortable and the take offs and landings were so smooth and breathtaking. All the stars for this review! All the stars!!!

review.name: Great Experience
review.reviewBody: We took the 20 minute sightseeing tour. Flying in a seaplane was a new experience for us and was definitely worth it. Take off and landing was very smooth. The flight gave a great perspective on Seattle and the surrounding areas, flying over Lake Washington, along the canal and Puget Sound with lovely views of the city. Really glad we did it and good value for money.

review.name: The only way to travel to Victoria! Absolutely epic.
review.reviewBody:
My wife and I had limited time to visit Victoria. She had never been before, and I considered the Clipper, before I realized I could enjoy a lifelong dream of flying in a seaplane for only a bit more money.
Service on both ends was amazing, our pilots were both fantastic, and the overall experience was just outstanding. I couldn't have been happier. The experience, the views, all out of this world. 
As a native Seattleite, I always drove to Vancouver to take the ferry over, but when you're in the city without a car, these "more expensive" options (like the clipper or Kenmore Air) become much more reasonable. I even heard one guy say it was cheaper than flying from Sea-Tac to Victoria, nevermind the fact that he'd have to deal with ground transportation on either end, and long airport delays! 
Definitely check it out, you owe it to yourself!

review.name: Wonderful tour
review.reviewBody: Beautiful day with a great way to fly over Seattle with a great recorded commentary. Wish it was in multi language

name: Olympic Peninsula and Forest Tour
description:
On the Olympic Peninsula, the lush ferns and mosses will make you forget the real world.  

There are plenty of stops for restrooms and stretching, lunch is included. You can choose if you want to walk or just sit and take in the magic these trails have to offer.

This day tour begins at 9:00am and ends at 6:00pm.

review.name: Amazing tour with Cheryl
review.reviewBody: Cheryl not only entertained us with her insightful talk about geology of Olympic peninsula and biology of temperate rainforest forest but also guided us to the uncrowded beautiful trails courteously telling us about the plants and animals we witnessed. This tour became unforgettable memory.

name: Alki Beach Bikes and Bites
description: Bike along Seattle's favorite beach neighborhood for an exciting Alki Beach, Bike and Food Tour! Knowledgeable and friendly tour guides will lead a 3-hour biking tour for some of the best food in the area. Visit up to 5 local eateries for up to 8 samples. Samples may include a Hawaiian-Korean fusion dish, fresh fish and chips, a hand-made milkshake, a slice of hand-tossed pizza and more. Experience a tour that combines biking and the best bites of the beach!

review.name: Great Ride
review.reviewBody: We had a great time on our tour. The bike ride is easy, lots of stops for great food and we learned some interesting historical facts about Seattle. Enjoyed discovering Alki Beach. Couldn't ask for a better setting or tour guide.

review.name: Relaxing way to explore a new part of Seattle.
review.reviewBody: We had a great time on the tour. The bike ride was easy and relaxing and the food portions were huge. Definitely enough for lunch. Other food tours in the area were around $50/ $60. So for the extra $20/$30 to have larger portions and an enjoyable bike ride (that did not feel like 6 miles!) taste of Seattle bites, beach and bike tour is worth it for tourists and locals alike.  This tour was definitely a highlight of our trip to seattle.

review.name: Great for both local and out-of-town tourists
review.reviewBody:
I have lived in Seattle for about a year but had not yet spent time on Alki Beach. My friend was in town visiting from Eastern Washington, and we decided to give this tour a try. It was one of my favorite local excursions yet. I hadn't been on a bike in a while, but you know the saying, and the 6-or-so-mile ride was very pleasant (and appropriate for people of almost all fitness levels). Felicia did a great job of giving us some insights and history about different locations along the tour without making it feel too touristy. The cadence of the tour was great--I never felt like we were lingering in one spot for too long, but we were also allowed to sit down and enjoy ourselves at the different food stops along the way. Our "tasting" options were delicious and diverse. And filling. I was happy I hadn't eaten breakfast that morning. 

Overall, I felt like I really got a great Alki experience and was able to visit more places than I would have if I had just gone over for a day trip on my own. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting from out of town and even local Seattleites looking for a fun afternoon activity. 

One tip: if it's a sunny day (lucky you!) and you are fair-skinned like I am, make sure to pack your sunscreen.

review.name: Food, Fun, Bikes and Fun
review.reviewBody: Ninety degrees and sunny in Seattle....wha-at?  What to do?  Thought Seattle was all rain and hanging out in coffee shops?  Take the Water Taxi from Downtown Seattle to West Seattle and enjoy some food, fun, bikes and fun.  Taste Seattle Food Tours has an Alki Beach Food & Bike tour - what a fun way to spend an afternoon - sampling food, riding bikes, enjoying the views of the beach.

review.name: Alki Bike Tour - Delightful!
review.reviewBody: We did the new Alki Beach bike tour this weekend and it was great! I've done the Pioneer Square tour and the food on the Alki was more beach-y (like sliders, pizza, fish & chips) but it was excellent quality beach food. We sampled from five places (two were right next to each other - pizza from one and beer from the other) and the portions were perfect for the quantity of food plus bike riding. The pace on the bikes was perfect, and it helped us burn off all the calories. And as usual, I learned a lot about the area from Felicia, who kept the tour moving and interesting. The scenery was gorgeous, and the beach cruiser bikes were easy to ride. All in all, a really good experience and highly recommended.

itemListElement.name: Seattle Shore Excursion: Food and Cultural Tour of Pike Place Market

name: Seattle Shore Excursion: Food and Cultural Tour of Pike Place Market
description: While your cruise waits in the Seattle port, visit Seattle's most essential attraction – Pike Place Market – on this fun-filled shore excursion. During this 2-hour walking tour, eat your way through the city’s beloved culinary landmark and go behind the scenes with your professional guide. Taste locally made foods and beverages, many of which reflect Northwest cuisine or are quintessential Seattle treats, and meet the exceptional people that make Pike Place Market the fabulous place it is.

review.name: Tasty fun with a bit of history
review.reviewBody: Justin  was our tour guide an absolutely outstanding.  Yummy treats along with some powerful information and history of the area. Thank you for a great time.  Highly recommend.

review.name: A Great Time
review.reviewBody: We went on a food tour with Savor. Our guide, Katya, was wonderful. She was very informative, fun, and friendly. I would highly recommend this tour since it is before the market crowds. Lots of good tastings. I think 12. You also get a card at the end that will give you discounts from the places you stopped and a few others.

review.name: Best Tour Ever!
review.reviewBody:
I can’t say enough AMAZING things about our food tour and Miriam our guide! I’ve told everyone what a must do Savor Seattle Food Tours are when visiting Seattle. My teen and twenty something thought it was entertaining as well as filling. In fact, they only had a couple appetizers for dinner after our afternoon tour! We all enjoyed ourselves while learning about the history of the market and Seattle. Additionally, we supported Beechers for lunch another day and we purchased Ellenos yogurt to enjoy while there and took it home after purchasing it in the airport.

Now, a few words about our tour guide, Miriam.  Entertaining! Knowledgeable! Accommodating! Thoughtful! Engaging! Personable! She was careful to wait and make space for the woman on the electric cart at every single location. She picked up extra menus for the gentleman who asked at every actual restaurant.  Miriam engaged each person on the tour, especially the younger ones and by getting to know them better she’d try to tie the tour information to their interests. She was fun and funny.  Honestly, if I lived in town, I would not only make sure that everyone who came to visit would go on the tour, I would do everything I could to make sure Miriam was their guide.

My only suggestion is to promote the Truffle shop as Truffle Oil or something because we thought we were getting chocolate truffles.

review.name: Fun, Informative, Delicious!!!
review.reviewBody: Our guide Heather was awesome--I loved following her around with her pink umbrella (it was really helpful--she knew we could easily lose her in the crowds--especially Saturday morning at Pike Place!).  It was fun getting the history and doing incredible sample noshing without waiting in line (Pike Place Chowder!).  HIGHLY recommend!  Your stomach and taste buds will love you forever.  Well, at least that day!  Be sure to bring a WATER BOTTLE--it says it in the printed information with the ticket, but who reads that?  Some of our fellow tasters were pretty thirsty by the end!  Oops!

review.name: A little sampling of lots of amazing food!
review.reviewBody: Miriam was a fantastic tour guide!!! There  were about 10 people in our group and she worked soooo hard!  This tour is the very best way to learn about Pike Market and some of its vendors. We were visiting for one month and we plan to go again when other friends come to visit us!

review.name: Amazing
review.reviewBody: This is THE way to see Pike Place Market. Skipping lines while trying all the best food and learning the history of the place. Highly recommend!

review.name: Excellent Tour!
review.reviewBody: We truly enjoyed our tour! Learning about the history and stories of the Pike Place Market was fascinating! The food was incredible..so good that we went back to get more Marionberry yogurt from Ellenos Greek Yogurt. As well, Mariam was a great guide!

review.name: Food tasting with Katya
review.reviewBody: Katya was so excited to share all her information with us! The food was so good, we were so excited to see the market!

review.name: Amazing way to experience and "taste" Pike Place
review.reviewBody:
We had an amazing tour with Matt who was passionate about the history of Pike Place, the history behind market.  In  addition he gave insight into the various vendors, the history of the food from each vendor and why the started in the market.

In total we tasted 16 different foods and were glad that we did the 11:30 tour as we would not have enjoyed the food if we had already had lunch.

Great tour, thxs Matt, I will always remember the pink umbrella.

review.name: Tour of five restaurants/bars
review.reviewBody: We had a ball, saw many places we had never seen even though we live in Seattle. Tour guide Will was a charmer, informative and fun. He's great. We would adopt him in a minute! Thanks for a great tour!

itemListElement.name: Seattle Cruise Excursion: Private Grand City Tour

name: Seattle Cruise Excursion: Private Grand City Tour
description: Make the most of your time before, after, or while in port in Seattle with this private tour of the city's must-see highlights including the Space Needle, Pike Place Market, Pioneer Square, the Ballard Locks and Queen Anne Hill. Visit local art galleries, sip coffee at the original Starbucks, and whiz up to the top of the Space Needle if you wish for incredible 360-degree views of Puget Sound, Mt Rainier and the Olympic Mountains. You'll learn all about the history of Seattle from your guide as you travel by van, making stops along the way to explore by foot and discover the best in food, shopping and entertainment. By the end of this private shore excursion, you’ll know Seattle like a local!

review.name: Mark was fantastic
review.reviewBody: Excellent city tour with Mark Williams as a tour guide.  Comprehensive, interesting and fun.  Great overview.   Highly recommend.

itemListElement.name: Seattle Pre-Cruise Tour: Transportation & Seattle City Tour

name: Seattle Pre-Cruise Tour: Transportation & Seattle City Tour
description: Making a short stop in Seattle before embarking on a cruise? Take this three-hour pre-cruise tour of Seattle and discover the best of the beautiful Emerald City! You’ll cover 50 miles in a comfortable, small-group mini-coach and enjoy the views of the city’s most iconic attractions, such as Mt Rainier, the Space Needle, Pike Place Market and much more. No need to worry, your guide will pick you up at your Seattle, SeaTac, or Tukwila hotel, take care of your luggage, and drop you off at Seattle’s cruise terminal with plenty of time to board your cruise.

review.name: great day
review.reviewBody: The views were amazing!  The tour guide was amazing and so knowledgeable  It makes me wish we could be there for a couple of days.  It was so nice to be picked up, see Seattle, and to be dropped off at our ship! Thank you for a great day.

review.name: Relaxing way to get to your cruise ship and see Seattle highlights
review.reviewBody: Great way to see Seattle and our guide was really great we saw the lock open and the boats coming in and out too. Seattle is a really lovely city and we got dropped right off at the boat no taxi hassle

review.name: Excellent tour and transportation
review.reviewBody: Our guide, Amy, was extremely knowledgeable and quite entertaining and being brought to the cruise pier was well worth the trip!

review.name: Does what it says on the tin...
review.reviewBody: Booked this for the convenience, and Northwest obliged. Our tour guide was informative and knowledgeable. He ensured we got some comfort breaks, went above and beyond for a client with special needs. All in all it was great as they stowed our luggage and dropped us off at the relevant dock in plenty of time for our cruise. Well done Tours Northwest

review.name: Dont go its a sh-t hole
review.reviewBody:
What a crap hole if a city!  Graffiti all over the road signs to the point you couldn’t see some exit numbers! Drug addicts everywhere. Hotel told us not to go out after dark. Ya lovely place….not

Get out of Seattle and it’s beautiful!

review.name: Would do it again!!!
review.reviewBody: Very informative, friendly, convenient and accommodating!!  I highly recommend this pre-cruise tour!!

review.name: “EXCELLENT” Tour guide🤗
review.reviewBody: The tour guide that we had, made the entire trip!!! She was absolutely the best. Knowledgeable, articulate and joyful. As a bonus, she sang to us, what a beautiful voice! You had better hang on to her!!!

review.name: Taste of Seattle
review.reviewBody: Fabulous tour with Tom seeing the wonderful Seattle sights.  He was so informative, friendly and was an overall enjoyable experience.  I highly recommend it!

review.name: Wonderful tour!
review.reviewBody: This tour was wonderful- they show you so much of Seattle when you’re only in town for a short amount of time. Our tour guide, Avery, was fantastic! He told us so much about all the sites we were seeing and answered any questions that we had. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to see Seattle prior to departing on a cruise.

review.name: Really informative tour and excellent service
review.reviewBody:
We had just one half-day in Seattle before joining a cruise to Alaska, and came across the Tours Northwest brochure which gave us the perfect solution to how to see the most we could of the city and get to our cruise on time and without hassle. 
We were picked up right on time from our hotel, and our baggage stowed in the back of the bus by our very jolly driver Doug, whose commentary throughout the tour was really interesting and informative. We didn't know much about Seattle before this and actually found we could have spent more time there quite happily. Anyway, we got to see many of the city's neighbourhoods and attractions and got a feel for the place, with several stops to walk around and take photos etc. Even got to see the famous view of Seattle from 'Frasier's' eyrie. At end of tour, Doug dropped us off at the cruise terminal with plenty of time to spare. A most enjoyable morning and well worth doing as an orientation if you haven't been to Seattle before.

itemListElement.name: Seattle Pre-Cruise Excursion: Highlights Sightseeing Tour

name: Seattle Pre-Cruise Excursion: Highlights Sightseeing Tour
description: Pike Place Market and Pioneer Square are just some of the prominent landmarks you see on this tour of Seattle highlights. During a 1.5-hour shore excursion by minibus, an informative guide entertains you with commentary about the city’s history and pop culture while you listen to tunes by Kurt Cobain and other Seattle musicians. Pass by the University of Washington, Chinatown, Lake Union’s floating homes, the Space Needle and more. You will be picked up at your University district hotel, Lake Union hotel, or downtown hotel and then dropped off at the cruise terminal at the end.

review.name: DON"T MISS the Chance to Tour with Chuck!!
review.reviewBody: Four of us took the pre-cruise tour on a Sunday AM. The guide - Chuck aka "The Chuckster" is an absolute RIOT.  He was kind enough to pick us up at the  hotel (not a normal stop for him).  The bus was comfortable with plenty of storage for our cruise luggage.  The tour was 30 minute longer than we expected and did I mention Chuck?  The Chuckster??  Once you've met him you will never forget him!  We got to see many of the highlights of Seattle, which we would never have seen on our few hours there, had it not been for this tour.   It was a fantastic time and we were all so glad we did this tour.  See the pictures for all the highlights!

review.name: Great Way to Tour Seattle Before A Cruise
review.reviewBody:
This is a fabulous tour. The Chuckster is entertaining as well as informative. We covered a great deal of Seattle in a short time, but never felt rushed. 

HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

GREAT WAY TO START YOUR CRUISE VACATION!!!

review.name: Chuckster Rocks
review.reviewBody: Spent the morning with the Chuckster as he drove our group around for a tour of Seattle before our cruise.  He kept things light and humorous throughout the tour.  He picked us up and delivered us to the ship on time.

review.name: Best and funniest tour ever!
review.reviewBody: This tour was awesome!  Chuckster was so dang funny!  We saw Seattle from one side to the other before we boarded our cruise to Alaska.  If we ever go to Seattle again, we will definitely look for this tour again, but a longer version.

review.name: Best City Tour Yet!
review.reviewBody: Wow! Chuck was fantastic as a tour guide. Highly informative, fun, lots of energy and took us to some great places!  My family and I had a blast on this 90 minute tour. There is truly no better way to experience Seattle on a time crunch.

review.name: Didn't do the tour but please read!
review.reviewBody: We booked this tour but found out once we got to Seattle that our hotel was not in their path. It was not that big of a problem but the guy who handled our cancellation refunded our money immediately and then contacted us three more times to try to get us set up and when he could not he hooked us up with another company. Way above and beyond what was required of him. Be advised that the visitor representatives do NOT always know which hotels are in the range of their tours. This company will definitely get our business next time!

itemListElement.name: Seattle's Favorite Sightseeing Floating Homes Cruise - BYOB!

name: Seattle's Favorite Sightseeing Floating Homes Cruise - BYOB!
description:
Experience the best of Seattle's urban and natural beauty with a Lake Union sightseeing cruise. This delightful excursion offers a perfect blend of exploration, relaxation, and delightful commentary while taking in the iconic sights of the city.

Enjoy stunning Lake Union panoramas, perfect for Instagram-worthy moments.
Capture the iconic Space Needle from a unique angle.

Cruise by the historic Gas Works Park, offering fantastic photo opportunities.

See the city's impressive skyline, including architectural wonders.

Learn about the city's history and landmarks from knowledgeable guides.

Ideal for those with limited time or seeking a quick, memorable experience.

Our marina is centrally located for easy access.

Join us for a short but memorable two-hour Lake Union sightseeing cruise. It's the perfect way to discover the best of Seattle.

review.name: A great way to spend an afternoon in Seattle without crowds of tourists.
review.reviewBody: We had a fabulous afternoon cruising around Lake Union, seeing the sites, and enjoying cocktails with Captain Dylan. I love that this was a small group experience, which are always the best kind. You can probably see the same stuff on a large tour boat but this is like having your own boat cruising around with friends, as Dylan told us stories and gave us background on everything we saw around the lake. The sun was shining, the day was warm, but not too hot. A perfect day spent waiting for our Alaska cruise to commence the following cay.

review.name: You definitely need to do this boat tour!!
review.reviewBody: I can’t say enough good things about this tour!!  When I got to the boat I realized I couldn’t get into the boat, with my bad knee. The owner said there was another boat coming in in about an hour that I could get into. He found a shady seat and even brought us a beer while we waited.  He was so thoughtful!! The boat ride was definitely worth the wait!  Genevieve did a wonderful job!  The floating houses were amazing!  We saw water planes take off and land, people jumping off their front porches into the lake, dug out canoes. Such a fun trip!  I highly recommend!!

review.name: Nice chill cruise and great drinks!
review.reviewBody: Nice chill cruise around the Union. Drinks were excellent! For some time on the water and good cocktails this trip is a good choice!

review.name: Fun and friendly!
review.reviewBody: Fun friendly and interesting! I learned some things about the city I grew up in and really enjoyed getting to tour the city from the water.

review.name: Boatload of fun
review.reviewBody: Great experience, Curt was the coolest tour guide definitely recommend. He shared a lot of history and insight on the properties of Lake Union.

review.name: Great experience - don't miss!!
review.reviewBody: The weather was perfect and so was the cruise.  Dylan was a great tour guide - he told historical stories and was pleasant and friendly.  He is also a great bartender. :)  The cruise was relaxing and very enjoyable.  Our family loved every minute!

review.name: Fantastic boat tour!
review.reviewBody: Great trip with my husband and my parents. Lovely way to see Seattle and great stories and information from Captain Dylan!

review.name: Neat, intimate and relaxing
review.reviewBody: It was very pleasant experience. Family which was joining the ride was very pleasant. Including capitan.

review.name: Great day!
review.reviewBody: This was a nice relaxing couple hours on the water! It was just my boyfriend and I and another couple we didn’t know before. It was a nice intimate experience on a beautiful day. We got to get away from the hubbub of the city and just enjoy the water. Captain Davis was great as well! Solid bartender and tour guide. I wish I could have spent all day out there!

review.name: 2023 UW Graduation Family Celebration Cruise
review.reviewBody: So much fun. Nice relaxing cruise with the family celebrating our UW grad. Davis was an excellent host and had tons of fun facts about where we were without sounding like a full-on tour guide. We packed a big picnic and they had drinks on board for purchase (and it wasn't nearly as expensive as was anticipated). It was great being able to go through the cut and be in another lake. Views were spectacular from every angle.

itemListElement.name: Chef Guided Food Tour of Pike Place Market

name: Chef Guided Food Tour of Pike Place Market
description:
This chef-guided market tour takes a journey through Pacific Northwest culture by tasting Seattle’s best artisan vendors in the famous Pike Place Market. Enjoy diverse tastings at 9 different locations— and food options like chocolate covered cherries, chowder, and much more. All groups are kept to 12 guests to ensure easier navigation of the market, more tastings, and a better platform to ask questions and interact with the group. Leave with a 10% discount card to shop and explore after the tour. 

*Note that tours stops may adjust depending on time of year and guide.

This is a walking tour that does require a moderate amount of physical fitness due to distance, small hills, stairs and cobblestone terrain. 

This is a market tour that includes walking/standing and not a restaurant tour with a variety of food alternatives and sitting opportunities.

review.name: Perfect Introduction to the Market
review.reviewBody:
What a fantastic culinary adventure. Our super chef, Stone, deftly guided us through the market, treating us to  a wide range of delightful samples. My favorites were the Beechers homemade cheese, the fresh pork tacos, the dreamy Pike Place Chowder and the “have I died and gone to heaven” Frans chocolates. 
Chef Stone infused history, lore, and current social justice issues into our walk, along with his extensive food and local knowledge. An excellent introduction to Seattle!

review.name: Noah May 2025 tour
review.reviewBody: Noah was great.  It was an amazing experience getting to learn so much history.  The food was great with a variety of different flavors.  We would highly recommend this tour and Noah.

review.name: Great tour
review.reviewBody: We enjoyed our tour with Noah. We tried some great tastings and learned a lot about food and history of Seattle. He was very knowledgeable, energetic and enthusiastic.

review.name: Delicious and Fun Tour!
review.reviewBody:
Best tour ever!  Chef Stone educated us about Pikes Market and had samplings from 10 restaurants and food vendors.  Of course we had Pikes Market chowder, candies, cheese, pizza, coffee and much much more.  Stone explained all tastings in detail and gave us a great explanation of Pikes Market. We'll be back tomorrow to continue the adventure.
This is a must see while in Seattle!

review.name: Guided tour of my Place market
review.reviewBody: our tour guide Jonathan took us to some of the hidden gems in the market and kept up a steady monologue of history of the area and other interesting anecdotes, he is funny and engaging and I can highly recommend this Tour and Jonathan.

review.name: This is a meal!
