review.reviewBody: Everything was amazing, our tour guide Jonathan was fun and knowledgeable.I’m sure it takes a lot to have that type of cooperation with so many vendors. Worth it! We sampled food from a ton of places. learned quite a bit about the food and why it’s special and what it takes to be a vendor. Made us want to try more those places hade to offer, we did go back to many locations for more! Don’t miss this and don’t eat before hand.

review.name: Fun and informative
review.reviewBody: Jonathan was an enjoyable , engaging and thoughtful guide.  People at the market even knew him and provided something extra for our group.

review.name: Chef Noah is the BEST!
review.reviewBody: Chef Noah was an exceptional guide.  First off, great personality.  Very friendly and entertaining.  We enjoyed a lot of the stories of the history of Seattle and the market.  If you are fortunate, you will have Noah as a guide.

review.name: Don’t miss this tour!
review.reviewBody: This tour is a great way to explore Pike Place!!!  The combination of knowledge and personality in our tour guide, Scott Perman, was FABULOUS!

review.name: AMAZINGLY !!!!
review.reviewBody: We had a great experience!!! I love the route and the moving around was amazing and clear to understand !!! And also great at communicating

itemListElement.name: Seattle City and Snoqualmie Falls Half-Day Guided Tour

name: Seattle City and Snoqualmie Falls Half-Day Guided Tour
description: With two activities in one 4-hour tour, see the top sights of the Seattle area, both natural and manmade. First visit Snoqualmie Falls, a waterfall in the foothills of the Cascade Mountains. Then experience Seattle on a city tour that introduces you to the attractions and history that make Seattle one of the most livable cities in America. Listen to fun facts and engaging stories about Seattle from a guide, and learn how the city got its name and what the real story is about how much it rains. The itinerary ensures adequate time spent at each location, allowing individual feedback and suggestions from the guide.

review.name: Amazing With Terry!
review.reviewBody: This was the best part of our entire trip and it was all thanks to the tour guide, Terry. We expected amazing views, but what we didn’t expect were the amazing tips on how to take great pictures. Terry gave us amazing tips and even took great pictures of us. He provided a lot of history and fun facts about Seattle. He truly made the experience next level. 10/10 would recommend this tour.

review.name: Top Notch trip to experience all Seattle has to offer!
review.reviewBody: I do not give reviews very often but I felt compelled to do so here.  First time for my wife and I to Seattle and we thought it would help to have someone show us around.  Two things stood out with this tour, first was the fact that we were shown not just the city but the surrounding area.  The falls visit was spectacular and Terry showed us many hidden gems throughout the tour.  The second but most important part of the tour was our guide, Terry.  He went above and beyond ensuring that our tour was time well spent.  From his historical knowledge of the city to his expertise with photography, we were able to get a feel for Seattle.  He even made recommendations on where to eat after - Highly recommend Cutters Crabhouse! Thank you, Terry, for making this a top-notch experience.  It was four hours of time well spent and i highly recommend this to anyone who wants to experience the Seattle area

review.name: Brilliant all round tour
review.reviewBody:
Excellent 4 hour tour not just the falls also a city tour.
Excellent knowledge and friendly.  Lots of photo opportunities, the guide also gave tips on taking good photos.
Would recommend,  especially if you don't want the trek option on all day tours.

review.name: Kept me intrigued!
review.reviewBody: Terry was awesome! Interesting facts with history backgrounds; kept me intrigued. Would definitely try another tour with him as a guide.

review.name: exceptional tour
review.reviewBody: I really appreciate it this tour. It was very nice. Getting to know what Seattle offers, especially in the outskirts of the city. It was our very first tour.thank you

review.name: Best Seattle City and Snoqualmie Falls Tour
review.reviewBody: Our tour guide Dale was amazing! He’s very kind and friendly while conducting the tour. He seemed very knowledgeable of the whole area and gave us some interesting rundown of Seattle’s history. Thank you for making my birthday getaway special and fun! I’d definitely recommend taking this tour!

review.name: Fun day in the rain
review.reviewBody: We had a very fun time. Even in the rain the guide had umbrellas for us. He was very knowledgeable and entertaining. He pointed out very fun and interesting facts about Seattle. The falls are amazing, but the troll under the bridge was just as fun.

review.name: Great Tour! Would do it again!
review.reviewBody: Dales is a great tour guide, and he provided us with the best info and views! He even showed us a spot while visiting the Snoqualmie Falls while it was raining. Great tour overall!

review.name: Fantastic tour
review.reviewBody: This tour was great. Made even better by our tour guide Terry. Very informative with lovely extra bits of info given along the way. Great at answering our many questions. The falls were a highlight for me personally but the whole tour was great. Really interesting and lots of good photo opportunities. Terry also shared some great tips for taking photos which I continued to use for the rest of  my holiday. Plenty of comfort breaks along the way if needed. A good basic understanding of Seattle history and sights was gained from this tour. Would definitely recommend

review.name: Great Tour!
review.reviewBody: The tour was great! Our tour guide was full of knowledge regarding the city and the falls. He took some great pictures of me and my mom and also gave us some great tips on taking our own photos!

itemListElement.name: Pioneer Square Food and Cultural Walking Tour

name: Pioneer Square Food and Cultural Walking Tour
description: Take a journey and step off the "eaten path" with a food and cultural walking tour through Pioneer Square, Seattle's oldest neighborhood. Taste unique food and drinks from local restaurant and specialty shops in the area while exploring historical tidbits and hidden gems Pioneer Square has to offer.

review.name: Awesome slow food in Pioneer Square
review.reviewBody: This fabulous walking tour of Seattle's historic Pioneer Square was the best thing we did in 4 days in Seattle. Roen was an excellent guide, covering the history of the area and combining it with 8 very impressive food or drink locations along the way. We learnt heaps, and really enjoyed the wonderful slow food / drink we tried, such a change from the usual fast food America is famous for. It was obvious from the start that the creators of these products were passionate about the ingredients and quality of their product, and Roen was passionate about opening our eyes to the growing food culture of the area. Excellent value for the money, highly recommended if you're passionate about local, quality food produced with pride.

itemListElement.name: Luxury Private Mount Saint Helens Day Trip

name: Luxury Private Mount Saint Helens Day Trip
description: Private Tour: You'll see the devastation caused by the 1980 eruption and the slow return of nature’s flora. A full day of scenery and adventure, you'll visit the Johnston Ridge Visitor Center, see a video of the eruption, see spectacular scenery (weather permitting) walk some easy trails if you wish, see newly formed lakes, and have a break for lunch. This is a popular tour.

itemListElement.name: Snoqualmie Falls + Wine Tasting: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour

name: Snoqualmie Falls + Wine Tasting: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour
description:
Experience Snoqualmie Falls and the Woodinville wine scene with a local, TripAdvisor 'Hall of Fame' guide. 'Certified Excellent' every year since 2010, our small groups (10 travelers or fewer) travel in a comfortable, high-roofed van on a behind-the-scenes look at the best of the Pacific Northwest.

We focus on boutique, family-operated wineries that showcase Washington's unique wine industry. We'll take care of everything for you today including: tasting fees at outstanding local wineries, gratuities for the tasting staff there, and a locally sourced lunch. We'll also provide snacks, water, and sparkling water to make sure you're comfortable. Let us know if you need warm clothing or have any dietary restrictions!

This isn't another bus tour; our experienced educators aim to keep your day relaxing, unique, without waiting in lines, and well - yours!

review.name: スノコルミー滝とワイナリーツアー
review.reviewBody:
素晴らしい眺めでした。
午前中にスノコルミー滝を歩いて散策し、お昼ごはん食べながら、ワインテースティングして、他にも二件テースティングできて良かったです。

review.name: Winery tour
review.reviewBody: Kenzie was awesome! Great lunch and knowledgeable. Nice van, bathroom breaks. A little walking but not too much. Beautiful views of Squalomie Falls.

review.name: Memorable experience for both expert and novice wine tasters. Beautiful scenery.
review.reviewBody: My husband and I were in the area for our honeymoon and we were lucky enough to have Ben as our tour guide. He was incredibly friendly, knowledgable about the area, and got our group around safely. We had a great group of people and it was a super memorable day. All the wineries were great! Both experts and novices in wine tasting would enjoy this tour. I would recommend it to anyone.

review.name: Snoqualmie Falls & Winery Tour
review.reviewBody: This was an outstanding tour led by Evergreen Escapes and I highly recommend it.  Snoqualmie falls was very scenic and the hike was simple and low impact.   The 3 wineries were all very good but the highlight was the William Grassie winery where we had a nice lunch while talking to the owner and winemaker Bill Grassie.   Karen our tour guide was tremendous (we also had her on the Olympic NP tour).   She’s highly knowledgeable, very friendly and overall a great host.

review.name: Snoqualmie Falls & Wine Tasting
review.reviewBody: Fantastic all inclusive trip!  We learned so much about the area, Snoqualmie Falls and overall Washington State wine industry. The tour visited 3 tasting rooms of small wineries.

review.name: We 100% recommend!
review.reviewBody:
We absolutely loved this tour! Karen was so knowledgeable, and she brought a great energy to our tour, which made the whole experience that much more amazing. After the hiking portion of the tour concluded, we had the great fortune of being able to meet all of the wine makers. Their wine and conversation were absolutely delightful. Thank you for making our 6-year anniversary so memorable! 

We will 100% be recommending this tour (and Karen as the guide) to all of our friends and family.

review.name: We had an amazing tour!!!
review.reviewBody: Our Snoqualmie Falls/Wine Tour with Evergreen Escapes was amazing! Brent Maphis was incredibly knowledgable, fun, and he made our day so special. We had a great tour of Snowqualmie Falls, despite the rain, and we visited three different, top-notch wineries, All were happy to see Brent, and welcome us to their wineries. We definitely recommend Brent, and Evergreen Escapes!!!

review.name: Perfect combination of sightseeing and drinking
review.reviewBody: Fantastic way to spend the day, perfect combination of sightseeing and drinking :-). I loved the small wineries and interacting directly with the owners, listening to their origin stories. Brent is the best guide, very knowledgeable, we learned a lot from him!

review.name: Relaxing adventure
review.reviewBody: What a great day! Brent along with Ben, were absolutely amazing. Not to mention the other couple we traveled with were a delight. All together we enjoyed lots of delicious wine ( except our driver) along with a lot of laughter. Topped off by lovely weather! Would recommend to who wants something different.

review.name: Must do day trip!
review.reviewBody: Excellent all day experience with knowledgeable guide. Beautiful hike to falls, followed by intimate wine tasting at winemaker's beautiful home and garden where we also enjoyed a delicious lunch. Visits to two additional tasting rooms completed the day. Each winery was distinctly different, and made for a varied experience. Tour was thoroughly enjoyed by me, my husband and my 30 year old son. Highly recommend!

mainEntity.name: How do I arrange pickup for the Woodinville Wine & Snoqualmie Falls: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour from Seattle?

acceptedAnswer.text: We offer complimentary pick-up and drop-off wherever you’re staying in downtown Seattle – hotels, Airbnbs, vacation rentals, a private home, etc. Our operations team will connect with you 24 hours prior to your trip to confirm the time and location.

mainEntity.name: What should I wear for the Woodinville Wine & Snoqualmie Falls: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour from Seattle?

acceptedAnswer.text: Please wear closed-toe comfortable walking shoes, hiking shoes, or boots and bring a light wind/waterproof jacket. We also recommend dressing in layers, with a non-cotton outer layer (please avoid denim).

mainEntity.name: What should I bring with me on the Woodinville Wine & Snoqualmie Falls: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour from Seattle?

acceptedAnswer.text: A hat and sunglasses are great. Also, your cell phone or camera and any necessary medications are pretty much it! We're happy to take care of everything else!

mainEntity.name: How many wines do we sample on the Woodinville Wine & Snoqualmie Falls: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour from Seattle?

acceptedAnswer.text: Compare tasting notes as you try 4 to 6 wines at three beloved Woodinville-area wineries and get a behind-the-scenes look. All experience levels welcome!

mainEntity.name: Which wineries are visited during the Woodinville Wine & Snoqualmie Falls: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour from Seattle?

acceptedAnswer.text: Your guide will combine group preferences, weather considerations, and more to create a lovely day. We're likely to change wineries from day to day to give you the best possible experience. If you have a winery in mind, please let your guide know.

mainEntity.name: Do you have vegetarian options on the Woodinville Wine & Snoqualmie Falls: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour from Seattle?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes - Please be sure to enter in any special needs/requests in the "Special Requirements" box at checkout and we will do our best to accommodate you!

mainEntity.name: How strenuous is the Woodinville Wine & Snoqualmie Falls: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour from Seattle?

acceptedAnswer.text: We have built our trips to appeal to all abilities and interest levels, and are rated easy to moderate. Our tours have a maximum of ten guests, which allows your guide to tailor the activity level to your group.

mainEntity.name: What happens if it rains on the day of my Woodinville Wine & Snoqualmie Falls: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour from Seattle?

acceptedAnswer.text: Our guides craft the best itinerary to accommodate the weather. We run our tours rain or shine because the Pacific Northwest is stunning regardless of the weather. Frequently, wet weather only lasts an hour or so before things start to improve again!

itemListElement.name: Best of Olympic National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Day Tour

name: Best of Olympic National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Day Tour
description:
No two tours with Evergreen Escapes are the same! Our naturalist guides craft itineraries that reflect the best of what the National Park has to offer that day. Please note that the itinerary outlined is a SAMPLE of potential destinations that could be included in the tour.

Join our naturalist guides as we dive deep into Olympic National Park’s highlights on this all-inclusive day tour. The park is a UNESCO World Heritage Site remarkable for its ecological diversity. Visit turquoise lakes like Lake Crescent or Quinault and explore the fern-filled forests or trek through the giant trees to hidden waterfalls. Experience Washington's marine ecosystems with a visit the shoreline. We tailor the day based on what's best for the season, weather and group!

Our all-inclusive small-group day trip is limited to 10 travelers. We bring a local, organic lunch to eat outside when it's nice! We also bring coffee, tea, snacks, water, and other cold beverages for the day. Don’t worry about a thing.

review.name: Really recommend
review.reviewBody:
Fantastic tour, Matthew is an awesome guide, very friendly and knowledgeable.
Also was able to see black bears, black tails and sooty grouses.

review.name: Amazing day trip and Evan was superb !
review.reviewBody: Evan our tour guide was outstanding. He made a 2/3 hour journey fly by - he had the whole group engaged and chatting - excellent ! He was so knowledgeable while we were out and about - answering all of our questions. The quality of the food provided was first class too. Hikes, scenery everything brilliant. I would highly recommend.

review.name: Olympia National Park/Forest
review.reviewBody: On-time pick up at hotel.  A wide variety of sites visited on the peninsula.  Ocean beach, Old-Growth Forests, lakes with views of the mountain range.

review.name: Fun day tour with hot lunch!
review.reviewBody:
The tour was excellent, our guide Evan was amazing and kept the whole gang of strangers engaged.

They had a snacks, and also hot soup for lunch. 

Highly recommend this day tour and maybe even asking for Evan as the tour guide!

review.name: Beautiful tour with great guide!
review.reviewBody: Brent was an awesome tour guide. Very knowledgeable, friendly and easy going. The Crescent Lake lunch spot was enjoyable, as well as the hike in the woods. Great tour!

review.name: Olympic Nat'l Park, Hurricane Ridge. Salt Creek
review.reviewBody:
We did a day tour on Sunday Feb 9, being picked up in Port Angeles, where it was 40 degrees, a light wintry mix. Very early in the season and we couldn't have been happier with the lack of crowds. Evergreen Escapes contacted us to make sure we had the proper gear for the weather, which we had, but they still brought along extra gloves and rain gear. 

We started in Port Austin, picked up at our hotel. It was just the two of us and our guide Marty. We talked about what we wanted to see and do in the area and Marty tailored the trip to us. Our first stop was Hurricane Ridge. After passing the gate, and making way for the plow, we pulled over to put on the tire chains. Minutes later back on the road, discussing the geology of the area, how it was the sea floor  at one time. Beautiful switchback drive up, lots of gorgeous views and we had big breaks in the clouds giving us sunny valleys to look down on. Both on the way up and down we passed backcountry skiers setting off up the mountain for some gorgeous powder. 

Reaching the top we parked and it was prep for phase 2: snowshoeing. if you know how to walk, you know now how to snowshoe. Marty mad sure we were fitted right, gave us the option for trekking poles, explained how to walk in snowshoes and we set off. The local ski lift was open with skiers and snowboarders enjoying the fresh snow and 18 degrees. We set off over a meadow and into the trees. walking on 5-6 feet of snow. Do you know what a tree well is? Marty did and explained how they form and the danger they can present. Funny enough, walking a a downslope, my wife got caught on the edge of one and she used her poles to lever herself away from the edge and we pressed on. We got onto a trail that cross country skiers like to use for a downhill leg and we passed skiers and other snowshoers. it was a great walk in the snowy woods, quiet, pristine and just beautiful.

Coming back down from Hurricane Ridge we took a side road west through the forest, passing some beautiful homes on the edge of the Olympic National park and went over to the Elwah River and up the road as far as it would go, since the road had washed out short of the Elwah Dam Removal. the River is gorgeous, fast and cold and we're told it changes color with the season and the melting of snow and glaciers in summer. We did see a beautiful little waterfall jsut a quick 1/10 of a mile from the parking lot.

After that it was on to Lake Crescent. We drove up to a beautiful bay, with a great view of the lake and the mountains that drop seemingly to the water'e edge. Marty got the stoves going, soup was on, chicken was available with noodles or in the soup, some great scones and tea and we were warm and ready for more.

We next went to Salt Creek and if you didn't have someone local to get you there, you might miss it. There are sea stacks there, the tide was out and we walked a lot of the flats below the cliffs; tidal pools had clams and starfisn, lots of bullwhip kelp. No seals that day and a little too early for whales in the strait. But after exploring the flats we got back in the van and drove up to a coampground on the point. The campground was a former miltary gun emplacement in WWII, with bunkers still on-sght, some of which you can drive through. There's a great staircase and walkway to the water with excellent views back to the beach and of the Strait of Juan de Fuca.

After that we drove back to Port Angeles, taking a little detour down to the waterfront/harbor. A few ships moving in and out of port. We were a week early for seasonal start of the ferry to Victoria, B.C. but you can see across the strait to Victoria.

That was the end of our tour day because we had a car and were driving back to Seattle. The ferry ride is super easy, whether you do it yourself or if you're in the van. Either way, you get out of your car, up topside where you can sit inside or go outside and see the best views of Seattle. And we came in on the 6:30 ferry in early February, so the city was lit up and even looks beautifu at night. Our hotel was a 3 minute drive from the ferry so it was a breeze.

We had driven ourselves to Olympia the night before, getting up early and were at the the Quinnault Rainforest by 9am. We did a few different trail loops there through the rainforest.  We never heard or saw anyone else out on the trail. There was some fog, some breaks in the forest into sunny meadows, the river roars throught the gorges and the trail along Lake Quinnaut is a beautiful view. We then drove up to Ruby Beach, reaching it at low tide. Great seastacks, an easy trail down to the beach. The beach was piled high with driftwood, actually, huge tree trunks, many over a 100 feet long. We walked around those, found a log that had fallen across a stream and walked north of Ruby Beach, closer to seastacks and even more beautiful views. We told Marty about this and he said that Evergreen Escapes also does a 3 day tour in the area, and gets to those same places. I would definitely recommend taking the 3 day tour (you do stay indoors btw). 

We skimmed the highlights of the Olympic National Park on our own and with a guide. I certainly recommend going with a guide whether it's half-day, all day or 3 days. They'll show you more than you'd seeon your own and have so much knowledge about the area that they're happy to share as much as you want. We wholehertedly recommend that you use Evergreen Escapes when visiting the Pacific Northwest!

review.name: Olympic tour Jan 2025
review.reviewBody:
We had an awesome time exploring Olympic Park on this tour. We went way up high in the mountains to Hurricane Ridge and did some fun snowshoeing. Then way down low into the Elwha River Valley for a gourmet lunch by the river where we also saw a beautiful waterfall. Then onto Lake Crescent and a short hike around the rainforest. Had never seen old growth forest before. 

Our guide Evan was superb! He had excellent knowledge of the history, culture, and environment. We had good group camaraderie and exchanged stories and songs we like.

review.name: Great way to explore!
review.reviewBody: Trip was amazing! Our guide, Marty, was super knowledgeable and made the experience perfect! Liz, was great with communication and making sure I was where I needed to be. For someone who does not know the area, both made this experience easy and stressless. I traveled solo and was looking for a safe way to explore a park, hands down this was the perfect way to do it! I got a history lesson, saw some of the most beautiful parts of the park, but the best part might have been the outside lunch under beautiful trees! Meeting neat people was a bonus!  I would have book other adventures with them if time permitted but my experience with Evergreen will make me come back for more adventures in the future.

review.name: Great Day, Awesome Guide and Beautiful Park!
review.reviewBody: Excellent tour - all day excursion, went to many sites within Olympic National Park - amazing views.   I was happy with the tour and Marty (the guide) was very informative and knew the park really well.   Snowshoeing on Hurricane Ridge was neat & memorable and something I wouldn't have done solo.   The lunch hit the spot.  Overall, great day and thinking of my next trip with Evergreen!

review.name: Awesome Guided Trip to Mt Rainier
review.reviewBody: We took the day trip to Mt Rainier with Karen and it was awesome! Karen is so knowledgeable and made the trip so much more enjoyable for us. Getting picked up at our hotel in the morning, having coffee, snacks and lunch for us allowed us to focus on the trip. We were so pleased how it turned out and would do it again for another trip! Thanks Karen!!

mainEntity.name: How do I arrange pickup for the Best of Olympic National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Day Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: We offer complimentary pick-up and drop-off wherever you’re staying in downtown Seattle – hotels, Airbnbs, vacation rentals, a private home, etc. Our operations team will connect with you 24 hours prior to your trip to confirm the time and location.

mainEntity.name: What should I wear for the Best of Olympic National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Day Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: Please wear closed-toe comfortable walking shoes, hiking shoes, or boots and bring a light wind/waterproof jacket. We also recommend dressing in layers, with a non-cotton outer layer (please avoid denim).

mainEntity.name: What should I bring with me on the Best of Olympic National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Day Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: A hat and sunglasses are great. Also, your cell phone or camera and any necessary medications are pretty much it! We're happy to take care of everything else!

mainEntity.name: Do you have vegetarian options on the Best of Olympic National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Day Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes - Please be sure to enter in any special needs/requests in the "Special Requirements" box at checkout and we will do our best to accommodate you!

mainEntity.name: How strenuous is the Best of Olympic National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Day Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: We have built our trips to appeal to all abilities and interest levels, and are rated easy to moderate. Our tours have a maximum of ten guests, which allows your guide to tailor the activity level to your group.

mainEntity.name: What happens if it rains on the day of my Best of Olympic National Park from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Day Tour?

acceptedAnswer.text: Our guides craft the best itinerary to accommodate the weather. We run our tours rain or shine because the Pacific Northwest is stunning regardless of the weather. Frequently, wet weather only lasts an hour or so before things start to improve again!

name: Lake Union Cruise from Seattle
description:
From picturesque houseboat districts to panoramic views, experience the best of Seattle's Lake Union two different ways:

SATURDAYS - Wine Tasting Cruise
This 1.5-hour cruise encourages you to sit back, sip and savor the wine (and views). Our professionally trained wine stewards will guide you through tastings of each featured vintage as we enjoy the waters connecting Lake Union and Lake Washington. This cruise is highlights & sights only, no narration. All ages welcome, 21+ to taste.
- Three 3oz. pours of the featured wines
- Light commentary of the highlights & sights of the area

SUNDAYS - Historical Cruise on Lake Union
Around every bend our professional tour guides will reveal historical secrets (like the tricks of the prohibition-era rum runners), and illustrate how the 1936 U.S. men’s Olympic rowing team scored one of the most improbable gold medals in U.S. history. Bring the family to enjoy themselves on this informative, fully narrated 1.5 hr sailing.

review.name: Enjoyable “Adult Only” Cruise
review.reviewBody: Enjoyed the early 2hour wine cruise (started at 1pm)  with my adult children.  Seattle weather was partly cloudy and on/off showers.  Cleared up, could tour on upper deck, inside or front and back of boat.  Seating inside is on banquet chairs.  The cruise was delightful.  Friendly service. Great views with narration.  We all enjoyed it (young adults 25-30 and a 59 yr old) Recommend getting there early to get the seating you like best, but all views are good.  You get 3 tokens for the wine.  Two separate lines, one for tokens (checking ID) and one for wine.  Full bar and light snacks available too.

itemListElement.name: Luxury Leavenworth Day Trip through the Cascade Mountains

name: Luxury Leavenworth Day Trip through the Cascade Mountains
description:
This luxury and private SUV tour is for you. We provide quality snacks and complimentary BPA free water bottles for you to keep. See BIGFOOT. We also engage you with fun facts and great conversations on this mountain roads day trip. See Bridal Veil Falls, where Big Foot has been spotted! plus Deception Falls, and Snoqualmie Falls.

Leavenworth is fantastic, a faux Bavarian Alpine Village with character of its own. A beautiful small town, you'll have time to shop the many small businesses. Enjoy a delicious meal in one of the many restaurants. From Bavarian food to Mexican and Asian, there are many choices.

NOTE: IN WINTER, the waterfalls have no access. This will be a trip to visit Christmas wonderland, December through March. Enjoy the snow!

review.name: Amazing Tour of the Mountains, Waterfalls & Bavarian Village!
review.reviewBody: This Tour & Guide were Both Absolutely Amazing! Cheryl picked us up at the Cruise port upon return of our Alaska Cruise which was such a Blessing and from that time our Tour began!  She was so very kind, friendly and considerate of what we wanted to see and was very knowledgeable of the area! When in Seattle this is a MUST Do Tour! We were so please and could not have asked for more!

review.name: Countryside from Seattle
review.reviewBody: The entire trip had some many photo opportunities of beautiful landscapes, waterfalls and the quaint Bavarian town. We enjoyed the comfortable ride and Cheryl’s knowledge of the area.

review.name: Good day trip!
review.reviewBody: Lovely trip through mountains. Cheryl is  wonderful .. very friendly, attentive and knowledgeable!

review.name: Best day of our trip!
review.reviewBody: My daughter and I did the Snoqualmie Falls, Leavenworth, and Deception Falls tour with Cheryl. What a great day! Cheryl had interesting facts and stories along the route and recommendations in Leavenworth. Absolutely will tour with Cheryl again when next in the area!

review.name: Easy adventure thanks to Cheryl!
review.reviewBody:
My daughter and I wanted to see Leavenworth and Cheryl’s trip made it effortless for us. She picked us up promptly from our downtown hotel and whisked us off to Leavenworth. Along the way she shared information about Seattle and the surrounding areas. A native of Seattle, Cheryl was able to point out lots of interesting sights we would have never known about. Once we arrived my daughter and I had plenty of casually time to walk Leavenworth and take in the sights. Cheryl drove us back to Seattle by a new route so we were able to stop at several scenic overlooks. I recommend this tour 100% for anyone who wants to sit back and let someone else worry about navigating the windy mountainous roads! 
Thanks Cheryl!

review.name: The Best!
review.reviewBody: Cheryl was excellent! From the hug at the beginning of the morning to the end of the tour. She really tailored our day for us.  Letting us stay longer in Leavenworth to stopping at Gold Bar which was an extra stop we asked about.  So knowledgeable about the complete tour.  Made our day very relaxing.  The only thing bad was that the day went too fast! We would highly recommend this tour.  When back in this area again, we will book another tour from her. Thank you for a wonderful day, Cheryl!

review.name: excellent experience
review.reviewBody: an awesome town with good food and wonderful people will visit again highly recommend visiting try the German restaurants

review.name: trip to Leavenworth and falls
review.reviewBody:
Eric our guide was very knowledgeable..trip was great vehicle and amenities were excellent .

great  day except for the very hot temps

review.name: Cute town
review.reviewBody: Nice, relaxing, beautiful day.  My wife and I had a great time!  Leaveworth is a cute town, the wine is ok.

review.name: The most beautiful winter wonderland!!
review.reviewBody: This trip was the most amazing trip. My sons and I really enjoyed it to the fullest. Cheryl was very professional and thoughtful. She knew we hardly got the chance to see the snow from California, she gave us a sweet surprise by stopping half way to let us touched the snow etc. Also, she gave us plenty of time to explore Leavenworth on our own. We saw the most beautiful  “winter wonderland” there!! The best part was it was snowing while we were there. It was so magical!!! This is definitely a highly recommended trip if you have not been there during winter times.

itemListElement.name: Mt. St. Helens National Monument from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour

name: Mt. St. Helens National Monument from Seattle: All-Inclusive Small-Group Tour
description:
Explore Mt. St. Helens on a day tour tailored to you. Our local, TripAdvisor 'Hall of Fame' guides have been 'Certified Excellent' every year since 2010! Please note that the itinerary outlined is a SAMPLE of potential destinations that could be included in the tour.

Walk along the blast-swept Eruption Trail with panoramic views of the devastation and the mountain’s crater. You may even glimpse a herd of Roosevelt elk! 

No two tours with Evergreen Escapes are the same! Our guides craft itineraries that reflect the best of what the Park has to offer that day. We’ll offer stops at some of our favorite spots like Coldwater Lake or the Hummocks Trail. This isn’t just another driving tour of a beautiful landscape - we prefer to keep guests outside the vehicle for walks to experience firsthand.

Our all-inclusive small-group day tour is limited to just 10 travelers. We'll bring a local, organic, family-style lunch and eat outside when it's nice! Don’t worry about a thing!

review.name: Incredible Experience of Mount St. Helens!!
review.reviewBody: Brent Maphis, Naturalist Guide, took our tour group on a mind blowing excursion of Mount St. Helens National Volcanic Monument. The trip was worth every penny as it opened my thoughts to nature and the majestic power that the 1980 volcanic eruption of Mount Saint Helens caused. Yet, the damage of the 1980 eruption was replaced by new lakes and greenery. If you are open to seeing nature in a new way, and are willing to have your perceptions of the incredible force of the Mount Saint Helens 1980 volcanic eruption enhanced a thousand fold—then this tour is for you! Wow is all I can say! Brent Maphis, Naturalist Guide, did a spectacular job gently guiding the tour group toward a new and fuller understanding of the incredible Mount Saint Helens Volcanic Monument. Way to go to Evergreen Escapes and Brent Maphis on a job well done! Bravo!

review.name: A day among giants
review.reviewBody:
Did this tour last week (August 2024). Kayla was our guide, and she was awesome! She made sure we all got to know each other, and as it was me plus a party of four who knew each other, this made me feel part of the crew!

We swapped life stories during the drive and the social aspect was really pleasant without being overwhelming.

As for the tour itself, we made a stop in Lewis and Clark State Park to walk among the tall trees of a genuine pacific northwest old-growth forest, and it was an experience I will never, ever forget!

Sadly as we went on to the main part of our trip, we didn't get to see the top of Mount St.Helens, but the small walks that we did got us fairly close to the mountain and allowed us to appreciate nature's beauty and power.

We ended the day at a place called North Fork Survivors. This newly-founded museum dedicated to preserving the memory of the people who perished in the volcanic eruption is maintained by Joe, who happens to be a Sasquatch researcher working with a University to collect data on this elusive primate. He is passionate both about his work on his museum and about his research. He is as dedicated, articulate and convincing as he is friendly, and this stop on the way back to Seattle could very well be the highlight of your day!

The other guests were elderly people, and the so the tour was kind of mellow, but I didn't mind at all! It only showed me how Evergreen Escapes will tailor the day to people of all ages and abilities to make sure everybody gets the best out of their day.

My only (very minor) gripe is that I would've liked to see a bit more of Mount St.Helens from various other viewpoints, as this is the theme of the tour, but I still got to see plenty of it : )) 

So hats off to Kayla, who was funny, friendly, well-organized and insightful, for making this tour an unforgettable experience I most definitely recommend!

review.name: A Mountain of Fun
review.reviewBody: Our senior group of four was extraordinarily pleased with our 12-hour tour to Mount St.  Helen’s Monument. Our guide Kayla was extremely knowledgeable, friendly, articulate and had a great personality and a wonderful sense of humor. The tour itself was awesome. We hiked several trails  at appropriate intervals during the drive and were served a beautiful picnic lunch in a park near Coldwater Lake. Dinner plates with silverware,  tablecloth, and cloth napkins were set out with sliced chicken breast, a bean salad and a cheese corn salad, tofu, and dessert. It was a memorable tour with a number of other interesting stops and we all enjoyed the whole day. Definitely a 5-star adventure.

review.name: Two great days out
review.reviewBody: Great Trip to Mt St Helen’s with Brent and to Mt Rainier with Kenzie. Both guides highly knowledgeable. Breakfast lunch and snacks terrific. Mt St Helen’s was fascinating, the wildflowers and scenery at Mt Rainier spectacular

review.name: Mt St Helen tour
review.reviewBody: The driver cum guide was very helpful and explained every detail of tour. Stopped for breaks. Explored park areas with us.

review.name: Comfortable whole day trip.
review.reviewBody: It’s good that the guide Linz has good knowledge about Mt. St. Helens and he serve us well. We feel comfortable in our trip.

review.name: Mt St Helens trip
review.reviewBody: Awesome experience! Lindsey took us to some exciting views of the volcano and nearby old growth forest and birding sites.!Highly recommended!

review.name: Fabulous experience
review.reviewBody: Such a beautiful tour. The tour guide, Mal, was incredibly knowledgeable and gave us great context for what we saw in the landscape. The food we were served for breakfast and lunch was great - I love that they support other small local businesses. All in all it was a terrific day and I highly recommend this tour and this tour company!

review.name: Bucket list item ticked off in style. Nate, our tour guide, was knowledgeable and gave us a really enjoyable experience
review.reviewBody:
The whole day was excellent. The catering was seamless and different from - much better than what I expected from a packed lunch. We never felt rushed and we were given opportunities to tailor the tour to our needs, staying longer in one place and shorter elsewhere. 
Other tour companies may have cancelled a tour that only included 3 paid guests but we were given the best treatment. Definitely recommend them. Nate was the best guide!

review.name: A fantastic day!
review.reviewBody: We had an absolutely fantastic day. Our guide Tess was well prepared, knowledgeable, personable and professional in every way. She was excited and passionate about what she was doing and it showed in her organization of the trip and also in her knowledge of everything surrounding Mt. St. Helen. Everything, from the homemade meals to learning about the eruption and how quickly nature started getting things back to normal was centered around making this a great experience for us. I recommend this trip very highly, especially if Tess is your guide!

name: Downtown Seattle Shared Ride Transfers
description: Downtown Seattle and Pier 66 shared ride shuttle transfers to and from SeaTac Airport in a luxurious Mercedes Benz Sprinter. We provide complimentary meet and greet on arrival, free Wi-Fi, HDTV and much more.

itemListElement.name: Seattle-Tacoma International Airport Arrival Private Transfer by Luxury SUV

name: Seattle-Tacoma International Airport Arrival Private Transfer by Luxury SUV
description: Enjoy convenient private transportation between Seattle-Tacoma International Airport and your downtown Seattle hotel in the comfort of a newer model luxury private SUV.

itemListElement.name: Boeing Factory Tour with Guided Transport from Seattle

name: Boeing Factory Tour with Guided Transport from Seattle
description:
Round trip transportation and factory tour tickets are included in this guided excursion from downtown Seattle to the wonders of the Boeing Factory! 

The Boeing assembly plant is home to legendary planes like the 747, 777 and the world’s most advanced jetliner the 787 Dreamliner. You’ll have an opportunity to learn about Boeing’s long and storied history, go inside the world’s largest building to view airplanes in various stages of assembly, enjoy exhibits in the Future of Flight Gallery, and hang out on the “Strato Deck” for some plane spotting.

review.name: Great way to visit Boeing factory. No rental car needed.
review.reviewBody: Great way to see the Boeing factory, especially if you don't have a rental car. Convenient pickup near the downtown hotels. Our tour guide James was great. He kept everything very organized and was very informative.

review.name: Amazing experience
review.reviewBody: Amazing experience,highly recommend this tour.our tour guide Mathew  was excellent.He gave us allot of information on the way and on return to the Boeing factory.We also had an unexpected  drive past the rear of the facility on return  which included the stress test facility etc.He actualy stopped and explained some of the recent testing events that had taken place.

review.name: A must for aviators and enthusiasts
review.reviewBody: Was an highlight of my Seattle trip. Guide, timing and the trip itself were just right. Highly recommended for aviation professionals and enthusiast alike.

review.name: Boeing
review.reviewBody:
The driver was great, had lots of knowledge to share and did a great job.

The tour was good, was expecting to see more but enjoyed it and very happy that I went

review.name: Great tour with James
review.reviewBody: James the bus driver was very knowledgeable about the history of Boeing and it's place in Seattle, he took us around the airport grounds to see more jets parked up and explained what they were, all in all he was very good, would recommend this tour for those reasons alone, the factory tour itself was interesting, but you're limited to a viewing platform above the factory floor, but Tom our guide was very knowledgeable and explained how the 777 is built. The future flight museum part was a bit of a let down, and we only had about 40 mins to walk around there, I was done in about 20!

review.name: Great family outing
review.reviewBody: You don’t get to see a lot of the inside of the huge buildings, but what you see is really interesting. Elvis was a great tour guide.

review.name: Great tour driver and fascinating Boeing experience
review.reviewBody: Boeing tour is fascinating, especially for aviation enthusiasts. James was a great driver and tour guide. Knowledgeable, honest and informed opinions and analysis, not just a canned and bland tour.

review.name: Aircraft galore
review.reviewBody: From retired Air force one that carried JFK back after the assassination., to the space shuttle. Some experimental, some of long ago. From  history before they made aircraft to endless displays. Easy walking for seniors, nice food concession looking out to the runways. Its where air and space come together

review.name: A Seattle Must Do !  Fantastic!
review.reviewBody: This was a must do visit.  The factory tour was amazing and informative.  Our bus driver Dave aka "Elvis" was fantastic!  He was so informative and funny and made the trip time go so quickly.  He was very helpful at the Boeing factory by securing a couple of lockers for our bags and on the way back let us off at other attractions if it was on the way to his final stop.  Couldn't speak more highly of this company, staff and trip content!

review.name: Worth Seeing this.
review.reviewBody:
A very interesting visit. Great to see how aircraft are put together and the vast expanse of the site. 
Downside is all cameras, phones and the like to be put into a locker so no photos inside. Guide gave some poor information about when phones have to be locked up. We did as soon as we came in but don't need to until actually starting the tour.

name: Discovery Point Kayak Tour
description:
From Shilshole Bay to Discovery Point, you'll follow an ancient water route used by Seattle's earliest inhabitants. 

Once we've crossed the bay, you can hop out of your boat and explore Discovery Bluff, one of Seattle's most magnificent vantages of the Olympic Mountains and beautiful Mt. Rainier. Back down at the massive driftwood-strewn beach, we will enjoy a lunch (provided). 

Then we'll be off, back to Shilshole Marina to part ways until our next adventure.

-Meet at our docks in Shilshole Marina 20 minutes prior to tour departure

-Family friendly

-Beginner paddlers welcome

-Lunch provided

What to bring:
Warm clothes, preferably non-cotton
Water-appropriate shoes
A water-proof, wind-proof layer
Water bottle
Sunglasses and/or a sun hat

Please note that if your booking is for an odd number of people, the odd person might be paired up with a new friend or guide in a tandem kayak.

review.name: Fun staff outing with Ballard Kayak!
review.reviewBody:
What a fabulous way to bond with coworkers, enjoy this beautiful city we call home, and experience something new! Blaine and crew took care of all the details so all we needed to do was show up.

Not only are they certified for safety, they are super knowledgeable about the wildlife and history of the area.  We are a group of bird lovers, and were treated to views of  many bird and marine mammal species, including a visit to a Purple Martin colony right near the marina.

If you're looking for a family, corporate, or other group outing, we highly recommend Ballard Kayak!  They will make sure you're safe, having fun, and truly exploring Puget Sound. Thanks for the great day, Blaine!

review.name: Great way to spend the afternoon
review.reviewBody:
Afternoon tour to Discovery Point - we had Chloe as our guide.
Good material, excellent guide - we had fantastic weather as well, but this was a fun activity wth a very good tour guide. Easy going, but looking out for our safety and making sure we all had a good time.
I went on my own, so shared the kayak with Chloe which was good fun. She shares a lot of information, but is also genuinely interested in the people in our tour. Will definitely come back for another trip next time I'm Seattle

review.name: Fantastic views, great guide, fun trip.
review.reviewBody: We had a great time on our kayak trip this week.  Sam was a wonderful guide and very knowledgable about the area.  Our kids (8&12 ) also had a blast.  Thanks again!

review.name: Awesome guide - Unique perspective of city and shoreline
review.reviewBody: We loved the 2-hr kayak tour with our guide (Sam). He was great at pointing out different features and wildlife. It offered a unique view of Seattle and various points of interest. Most of our group had never kayaked before but we felt like the introduction and tips helped a lot. We all had a great time and would book again.

review.name: Great day on the water!
review.reviewBody: We were in Seattle to visit our son and decided to go kayaking.  I found Ballard Kayak & Paddleboard via TripAdvisor.  We went on the Discovery Point tour and had a great time!  Like the previous reviewer wrote... we saw seals, bald eagles, and a sea lion.  Our guide Devon did a great job... My wife ended up in his Kayak.  He took great care of her... and got an extra workout since she has had a shoulder injury and wasn't really up to paddling.  Lunch on the beach was nice... very good sandwiches and fruit!  This is a first class operation and highly recommended!

review.name: Seals, Sea Lions, Bald Eagles and a beach picnic!
review.reviewBody: I highly recommend Ballard Kayak & Paddleboard, I went on the Discovery Point tour and enjoyed every second of it. I saw a seal and a bald eagle with in 5 minutes of each other, this was then followed by a picnic lunch are a small quiet beach (sandwich, chips, drink, fresh fruit) before getting back in the kayak and making our way to Discovery Park which we then got out and walked around the light house that is there. On the way back we did a little bit of kayak surfing (which I didn't know was a thing) before entering the marina.

review.name: Nice way to spend half a day
review.reviewBody:
I did the Discovery Point trip this past weekend. It was a beautiful day, so I was surprised there were only 3 customers. Since I was solo, I was in the kayak with the guide, who was great. The other 2 were brand new to kayaking, so we didn't paddle as far or as fast as I had expected, but I had a very good time. Maybe I missed the small print, but I didn't expect to be in a 2-person kayak - I assumed I would have my own. I would have had a little more fun if I'd been free to paddle a little more.

But I highly recommend the company - everything was well-organized and it was a really nice day out on the water.

review.name: Great Views
review.reviewBody: We took the Discovery Point tour, it was a small group just our group of 2 and one other person. It was very relaxing and chill, we where able to see some sea otters that followed our Kayak. On Discovery Point, we hiked around a little bit and then just relaxed on the beach which was very secluded while having lunch. Overall, I would recommend it. It gets you away from the high tourist areas and your actually doing something versus just looking at something even though there was plenty of beautiful sites to see on the kayak.

review.name: A Fun Afternoon in Seattle
review.reviewBody:
During a recent getaway weekend to Seattle, we took the Discovery Point Kayak Tour (3 hours, with lunch included). Our guides, Blaine & Devon, were awesome: funny, patient, informative, helpful--even to the point of towing a kayak with people who couldn't get the hang of paddling! One of us was a beginner, and had no problems learning how to paddle/maneuver/steer even in open water.
The lunch provided was good, but not "gourmet"--sandwiches, chips, vitamin water, grapes, berries.
There is no short hike to Discovery Bluff--they need to remove this from the tour description, as we were looking forward to the hike. Our stop at the beach allowed for a brief (no more than 10 minutes) walk down the beach toward an inaccessible lighthouse.

review.name: Great Guides, Great Day Out!
review.reviewBody: We booked the Discovery Point Kayaking Tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. The kayaks seemed like good quality and our guides, Matt and Amanda, were really excellent. They gave a great little introduction to kayaking and then shared tons of interesting information during the tour - very knowledgeable about Sound ecology. Matt shared a kayak with our son (8-years-old) and kept him thoroughly engaged and excited about the trip. Thank you Matt! We saw about three harbor seals during the trip. The lunch was fine - sandwiches, fruit, and drinks - but tasted especially good on the beach at Discovery Point. We didn't hike - there was just enough time to explore the beach a bit and relax over lunch; if you want to hike you'd really have to grab your sandwich and get moving. For us it was perfect. The marina where they launch is really nice also - perfect spot to relax and have a coffee looking at the boats and cool Lief Ericson sculpture before or after the tour. Would definitely book again!

itemListElement.name: 3 Hour Show Me Seattle Best Of The City Tour

name: 3 Hour Show Me Seattle Best Of The City Tour
description: Our guides are renowned for their local area expertise. Get an insider's view of a city in a constant state of flux. Enjoy the major attractions and highlights of Seattle on a three hour tour in comfort and style aboard a comfortable mini-coach with no more than 14 guests. Fun, entertaining, and informative guides provide local flavor with personal anecdotes and historical nuggets only a local could know.  Hop off for picture postcard photo ops, and take a deeper dive at points of interest like the Hiram Chittenden Locks.

review.name: Show me Seattle tour
review.reviewBody:
Fabulous tour. Chip and Allen and Bob were extremely interesting, knowledgeable and friendly. The tour itself covered all the city highlights and also travelled to the outer suburbs. The coach was clean and comfortable. 
Chip also gave us a quick personal tour of the Pike Markets.

review.name: Sing Me Seattle
review.reviewBody: Matthew was a great tour guide and gave us lots of information. We were able to get out and take pictures a few times, get sandwiches and have a good overall of the city’s history and places to go and explore further after our tour. I would suggest it to any new visitors.

review.name: Would definitely do again.
review.reviewBody:
Sarah was our guide. She shared lots of information about the area and the market.
We had some great samplings of food and sweets.

review.name: A must to have them as your guide !
review.reviewBody:
My husband and I booked two seperate tours . I did the three hour city tour which was fabulous in a small bus we went even into the suburbs . 
My husband was booked for the Boeing tour which had to be modified due to a strike at the  factory . The level of communication and how they adapted the tour was exemplary . 
Great company

review.name: Well worth experience
review.reviewBody: Tour guide was excellent. We enjoyed overall experience of the Seattle area and its history. We did not visit the marketplace due to my wife's in ability to walk and no wheelchair availability

review.name: The perfect tour when you're tight on time
review.reviewBody: We were lucky enough to have James as our guide. He's got an astoundingly encyclopedic knowledge of the city and kept us entertained and informed for the entire tour. Do NOT miss this tour!!!!

review.name: Well worth it.
review.reviewBody: Excellent tour, Matthew was a great "singing" guide who loves his job and it shows.  Definitely worth while for killing time getting off a cruise and waiting for a flight.

review.name: An Incredible Experience
review.reviewBody: I admit it. I was skeptical. At 3 hours I thought I would be bored. News flash: I never was. Our driver, James, knew a lot about all the sights. We even had three stops to see even more. Definitely the best tour I've ever been on.

review.name: Best of Seattle tour!
review.reviewBody:
This is a great tour, very comprehensive! Mark was a great guide! He picked us up from our cruise ship in the morning. We saw many parts of Seattle that we didn’t even know to ask about (like the troll under the bridge)! He new all the right places, the best views, the history, the current hot spots. He was thoughtful enough to stop halfway at a local site for us to use the restroom and get snacks! When we were done, he got us to the airport on time! There was a delay with a bridge unexpectedly closed, but he got around it and we were still on time!

Our only regret was no information on or time at the space needle. And we didn’t get to stop at Pike Place Market, but I guess that is another tour.

review.name: Very kind and fun bus tour! Great way to explore Seattle
review.reviewBody:
We got off Alaska cruise NCL in Seattle Matthew picked us up and took us on amazing tour of the town. Plenty of stuff to visit and see also makes several stops for shopping coffee and a free chocolate sample. Singing songs information on Seattle history and interactive narrative. Highly recommend not just a drive and point bus tour. Very kind and helpful he even personally walked us to the space needle and made sure we got on the elevator. 5 star all the way! 
Also congratulations on the baby! Thank you

name: 90-Minute, Beginner Stand-Up Paddleboarding Lesson
description: Experience Seattle's shoreline on stand up paddleboarding, one of the fastest growing sports in the world. This 90-minute lesson will teach you how to explore the waters of Shilshole Bay, how to paddle, and how to safely balance and move.

itemListElement.name: Pacific Science Center General Exhibit Admission

name: Pacific Science Center General Exhibit Admission
description: Pacific Science Center near the Space Needle in Seattle is Washington’s leading attraction for fun and engaging experiences for families and guests of all ages. Explore hundreds of interactive exhibits, wander among fluttering tropical butterflies, tinker with reusable products, touch live marine animals, come face-to-face with prehistoric dinosaurs, see a live science demonstration featuring liquid nitrogen, fiery explosions and more. For an additional fee, guests can experience Pacific Science Center’s planetarium, laser dome, two IMAX® Theaters and traveling exhibitions.

review.name: Family fun
review.reviewBody: So much fun! We loved the interactive exhibits and the butterfly garden was great. My favorite area was the exhibits dedicated to the body

review.name: Here because Elvis made It Happened at The Worlds' Fair here!
review.reviewBody: Fantastic experience - well worth a visit! Lots to see lots to do! Enjoyed the shuttle rides from the hotel to here - then spent the day in here because there was lots to see - came because Elvis was here making 'It Happened at the World's Fair' Walking in his footsteps :) Elvis history - has to be done lol Butterflies were gorgeous - enjoyed watching a couple of Music concerts in the cinema - Loved the dinos! Loved the horror (sort of) ha ha eeekkkkk Great for children very educational. Lifts provided/drinking water on tap.  Highly recommend.

review.name: Waste of money
review.reviewBody: Last time I was there was about 10 years ago. Not only has there been little to no change in the exhibits, much of it is in disrepair. The water features are drained, but there is no mention of that on the website. 3/4 of the dinosaurs didn't work. Planaterium show was disorganized. The laser show was outdated and  underwhelming.  I spent almost $100 and another $30 on parking.  Felt cheated.

review.name: Good but..
review.reviewBody: The PSC is pretty great overall, a-lot of engaging exhibits for children. We came for the young children’s Planetarium show and it was not as I expected. The story telling and engagement were fine, but I expected more use of the Planetarium’s visual effects since that’s the part we came for that you can’t get elsewhere. There were also too few step stools for toddlers to engage on higher exhibits. The most frustrating part was waiting in line with people who needed tickets when we had pre-purchased tickets. An attendant was monitoring the line already and could have checked our Tickets and sent us in, relieving some of the stress on the cashiers and making our pre-purchase worthwhile.

review.name: A great rainy day outing in Seattle
review.reviewBody: Decided to Spend a few hours in Seattle. A great choice for the family was the PSC. The little one loved the hands on exhibits,the Dinosaurs and the VR exhibit. If you have been or have not, this is a great way to introduce the kiddos to fun science exhibits and even a I-Max movie. Do not miss the ButterFly House. It is very warm but beautiful and peaceful. Be careful where you step!

review.name: Science to the nth degree
review.reviewBody: Tons of things to see and earn about while doing hands on activities. The kids loved it as well as the adults. There is so much to see in the area, right by the water and in walking distance of many other attractiions

review.name: A lot to do here for kids
review.reviewBody: My husband and I came here with a friend to check it out.  There are several buildings to explore with all kinds of exhibits to see and interact with.  I especially enjoyed the butterfly garden.  There are also films running at different times of the day in the IMAX theater.  The films cost extra.

review.name: Just like when I was little
review.reviewBody: I used to live in oak harbor when I was in kindergarten and I remember coming here with my family. So of course when I came back to visit Seattle I had to come. It reminded me so much of when I was little. I feel like not much has changed. I remember my brother's boy scout troop sleeping in the dinosaur room. And of course the butterfly room was always my favorite and still is. It is not as busy as I remember it being, but then again I came during the middle of the week so that might have something to do with it. I spent literally hours and the butterfly room. I just could not get enough of it. I would gladly go back and do it again. It is $26 for an adult but they do offer military discount. I also went and saw the IMAX movie superdogs. Originally I was very skeptical thinking it would be a dumb kids movie but it was actually extremely entertaining. They talked about all the things dogs can be trained to do to help society from rescuing people from avalanches to finding them in natural disasters. They talk about how they choose the dogs and train them. I would highly recommend going and watching this video. Highly educational and very interesting. And that says a lot since I'm not a pet person. Overall a great day at the children's museum.

review.name: Fun butterflies
review.reviewBody: We went here for a few hours before our flight home to California. Fortunately, we had a membership with Discovery Cube so we were able to enter for free. My 8 and 10 year old enjoyed seeing the dinosaurs and walking through the butterfly area.

review.name: Felt like a Kid for the Day!
review.reviewBody:
This attraction was included in our city pass that my boyfriend and I got before spending the weekend in Seattle.  It was a fun experience! We usually have kids with us, but had the weekend for just us.  We had a blast! They had a scavenger hunt going on over the weekend, and it was fun to participate in that, and talk to staff we probably wouldn't have without it. 

They have a butterfly house with some beautiful butterflies, and we thought that was really neat, and they also have a tide pool area where you can touch the different creatures! The vibe is very similar to OMSI if your are from Portland Oregon or have been to OMSI there, but with some additional cool features.

Most of the exhibits were really interactive and fun, and made me want to take my 5 year old here when we come back! 

Overall, a great experience!

itemListElement.name: Taste Pike Place Walking Food Tour

name: Taste Pike Place Walking Food Tour
description: On this small-group 2 hour insider's food tour of Seattle's famous Pike Place Market, discover hidden culinary gems at out-of-the-way places as you explore back alleys and narrow corridors with an in-the-know guide, who shares stories of the market's cultural history, characters, and shops.

review.name: Great food !!
review.reviewBody: Our tour guide, Lucky, was informative and the selection of food was diverse and very good.  What needed to be served hot was hot and what needed to be warm was served warm.   Tour left on time and didn’t go overtime which was appreciated since we had a busy schedule.

review.name: Thank you, Woody, for a great experience at Pike Place Market.
review.reviewBody: My husband and I had a wonderful experience on our tour. Woody, our guide, was excellent and very informative and friendly.

review.name: Great tour with our great guide Lucky!
review.reviewBody: Our group of 11 had a great time on the walking tour and Lucky was a great tour guide! It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Seattle. We got to try some great food and drinks, while learning a lot of the market and city's history. I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting.

review.name: Definitely recommend! Chip made the tour outstanding!
review.reviewBody: Chip was our guide for our early morning likes place market tour and he was fantastic! Loved all of the historical knowledge he shared with us not only about the history of different parts of the market but also shared great recommendations on things to do while in Seattle and really just made the tour great. Loved all of the food (and drink) stops and the fact that it was so diverse! Thank you Chip! The tour exceeded our expectations! Love from Kevin and Felicia

review.name: Amazing food and mingling with the market locals
review.reviewBody: Shout out to our tour guide Lucky for mixing a ton of international experience and knowledge with information about the local history and culture of the market. The samples were excellent.  This was my second time on the tour, and it was even more amazing than last time. This was my friend’s first time on the tour, and he enjoyed it just as much as I did.

review.name: Get Lucky
review.reviewBody:
Met our guide Lucky after some difficulty (on our part) and the tour began. The five of us and about six others were present. Lucky began the tour with some history of the market, gave us some brief logistics of this expansive market and pointed out some interesting things along the waterfront.

Lucky took us through the very busy market on Saturday with ease as his experience was evident in not only how to get through the crowds but showing us the very best vendors. All of the tastings we were given were unique and t delicious. We got to see the salmon toss at the Pike Place Fish Market, and all in the group got to try the smoked salmon..

The two hour tour went by in a blink.  Lucky was knowledgeable, funny and very experienced. Without Lucky’s guidance, the market would have been overwhelming. If your interest lie in visiting the Pike Place Market, I highly recommend Show Me Seattle and by all means request Lucky, you won’t be disappointed.

review.name: Pike Place Market Tour
review.reviewBody: Our first time to Pike Place Market and Sarah was our guide. She was terrific and took us to so many amazing spots, some of which were Indi Chocolate, Pike Place Chowder, Frank’s Produce and The Truffle Queen. It was great visiting with the owners and learning all the inside information about their businesses. Watched them throw a gigantic halibut at Pike Place Fish Market! Great tour, highly recommend it.

review.name: Pike Place Market Food Tour
review.reviewBody: Woody was a great guide!  He gave us so much information about the Seattle area as well learning of all the places we stopped for a “bite”. We enjoyed a variety of foods. Every taste was excellent!  The clam chowder was so delicious!  Thank you Woody for an enjoyable morning.

review.name: Food and fun!
review.reviewBody: This was such a fun tour, and Chip was fantastic! From the initial contact to the follow-up information, we felt welcomed and well informed. Chip provided great history along with fun facts and humor. The food along the tour was delicious and allowed us to get an idea of what the market had to offer. I would highly recommend this tour for foodies!

review.name: Great tour, great food, great guide!
review.reviewBody: This is a great way to get to know Seattle and Pike Street Market. Woody, our guide, was fantastic. The food was delicious, diverse and we enjoyed it all! Thank you Woody! It was the a great 2 hours!

name: Downtown Seattle Restaurant Tour
description: This progressive dinner tour takes you from appetizers to dessert in just 2.5 hours, it features three can't miss restaurants, a stop for a craft cocktail at Seattle's famous Rob Roy lounge and a local host to share entertaining stories that keep things lively. Enjoy local fare from top chefs, and discover neighborhood hot spots on this unique, fun and tasty dinner crawl.

name: Seattle Wine & Chocolate Experience
description: Visit three of Seattle’s most prolific and prominent taste-makers as your charming local guide leads you on a stroll through historic Pioneer Square. Start with a flight of Northwest Wine at Browne Family Vineyards paired with charcuterie from Seattle favorite Salumi, visit Intrigue Chocolate Co. and experience old-world craftsmanship with a hosted tour and tasting, and finish up with paired wines & nosh from the wine-maker and chef team at Locus Wines. Hear stories about the colorful history of Seattle's oldest neighborhood while enjoying the best chocolate and wine in town! As an extra perk, guests can take advantage of VIP discounts on purchases during the tour.

review.name: Cancelled
review.reviewBody: Our tour was cancelled due to not having enough people. Was a disappointment for us. Since there is not a trip guarantee, I would not book again. Be sure to have a back up plan.

review.name: Tour
review.reviewBody: Awesome tour!  Took a tour of Starbucks Reserve which includes specialty coffee as well as bakery items. Then went to tour Frans chocolates and sample chocolates. They have the best salted caramels!!  Lastly we did a wine tasting at Browns!  Loved it!  A little pricey but worth it to do something different!

review.name: They cancelled
review.reviewBody:
My husband and I were very much looking forward to this tour.  We have mobility issues so I intentionally scheduled tours which did not require hiking and other physical activities.  We were very much looking forward to tasting different coffees. (We lived in Central America which makes some of the best coffee in the world.)  Unfortunately, we were the only two people signed up for this tour so, rather than run it for the two of us, they cancelled.  I never did get to do any chocolate tastings or tours of chocolate shops. VERY disappointing.

I will say that the owner went out of his way to confirm with me two days in advance; and then made EVERY effort imaginable to track me down to inform me of the cancellation.  He left a voice message for me at home, but realized it was an answering machine probably at my home and he knew I was on vacation out of state.  My cell phone doesn't usually work, but the owner persevered.  He called the hotel and the Front Desk Clerk tracked me down during the hotel's Wine Hour.  I appreciate the owner's efforts to not just stand us up; and I believe that he will in fact credit my AmEx card in full, therefore, in spite of the cancellation, I'll give them three stars. 

But I sure wish they would have run the tour for the two of us.  Do that and you'd get a bunch of five star reviews which will generate more interest going forward.  Just a thought...

review.name: Excellent Tour
review.reviewBody: Excellent tour.. Enjoyed each of the venues.  Our guide, DC, was very knowledgeable about each of the activities and we enjoyed the other members of our group

review.name: Exceeded expectations!
review.reviewBody: If all Starbuck's coffee could be as wonderful as that served at the Reserve Roastery - wow!!  We very much enjoyed the tour!!

review.name: So much fun!
review.reviewBody: We really enjoyed this tour! It had something for everyone! Starbucks Reserve was such fun! Interesting history and fabulous tasting! Fran’s Chocolates were decadent and worth every calorie! Finished our tour at The Estates for a lovely afternoon of wine tasting and delicious charcuterie. It was a wonderful tour and we highly recommend it!

review.name: An excellent tour - highly recommended
review.reviewBody: Taking this tour was a lovely re-introduction to Seattle after a recent move back to the city. I would also recommend it highly to those visiting for business or pleasure. It was a great combination of an interesting perspective on Seattle's history with amazing 'home grown' products to sample. Our guide James was the perfect host - his extensive knowledge of the city, solicitousness over his charge's comfort, and excellent good humor was a highlight of the tour, as well. Between James, the knowledgeable and enthusiastic guides at each site, the most enjoyable companionship of my fellow travelers, and the delicious coffees, chocolates, and wines with tapas, it was a great way to leisurely enjoy a side of the city I rarely take the time to see. Well worth it.

review.name: Loved Seattle Coffee, Chocolate & Wine Tour
review.reviewBody: This tour was wonderful - my husband and I enjoyed every part of it. Our guide, James, was very informative and knowledgeable - we truly appreciated him. We enjoyed all three parts of the tour and would recommend it to anyone visiting Seattle.

review.name: A great new tour worth the price and experience
review.reviewBody: I really enjoyed this 4 hour tour that included chocolate, coffee, and wine. Our tour guide, Neil was informative about everyday things around/about Seattle and an excellent driver. Starbucks Roastery was quite impressive and the coffee was superb. Fran's Chocolates is just a delight to see in action. The tastings were diverse and filling. Estates Wine Room  had substantial charcuterie serving and great wine tastings. The 14 person limit seems perfect for this tour and it was nice to be in 3 different neighborhoods: Capitol Hill, Georgetown, Pioneer Square. Comfy motor coach and great pick-up/drop-off location.

review.name: Coffee at Starbucks Roastery, Chocolate at Franz and wine
review.reviewBody: excellant experience. convenient pickup and dropoff spots in the city. Lots of inside information with very friendly guides at each place. Enjoyed the morning. We received a lot more than expected.

itemListElement.name: Seattle's Best Private Sailing Adventure on the Puget Sound BYOB!

name: Seattle's Best Private Sailing Adventure on the Puget Sound BYOB!
description:
Escape the hustle and bustle of city life and embark on an exclusive 3-hour private sailing tour in the Puget Sound. This personalized voyage is designed for up to six passengers, offering an intimate and unforgettable experience as you explore the stunning natural beauty of the Pacific Northwest.

Sailing in the Puget Sound offers you the chance to relax and unwind while taking in breathtaking views of the Olympic Mountains on the western horizon and the Cascade Range to the east. Keep an eye out for local wildlife such as seals, sea lions, and, on the luckiest of days, whales!

If the conditions are right, you may have the option to become more involved in the sailing experience. 

This private 3-hour sailing tour in the Puget Sound for up to six passengers offers a perfect blend of relaxation, and exploration. It's an ideal option for families, friends, or small groups looking to create lasting memories in a private and intimate setting.

review.name: Great sailing
review.reviewBody: Excellent sailing with Captain Russ! Would highly recommend. Easy to book. Clear directions. Great facility. Knowledgeable and friendly captain!

review.name: Peaceful and relaxing afternoon on the water
review.reviewBody: Captain Russ was knowledgeable and entertaining.  Although we did not have much wind to sail, it was a calm and relaxing experience.  We saw the Seattle skyline, Ballard locks/Magnolia area and marine life.  Nice family afternoon.

review.name: Great opportunity to experience sailing on the Puget Sound.
review.reviewBody: This was the third time we have gone out with Captain Russ, who adds so much to the experience of sailing on the Puget Sound.  A Master Seaman whose sailing skills are impressive.  Highly recommend for a memorable trip.

review.name: Great Sailing Trip
review.reviewBody: Fantastic sailing with Russ. We loved every minute of it. Beautiful and peaceful setting that was fun for our whole family.

review.name: Amazing experience
review.reviewBody: fantastic trip with a wonderful skipper. Russ was extremely knowledgeable, friendly and made the whole trip very special. We even saw a hump back whale! an unforgettable experience the whole family will remember - highly recommend this company for a private trip.

review.name: Relaxing ride in the sound
review.reviewBody: Russ was super accommodating and very fun to hang out with. He has a lot of experience and was knowledgeable about the area and sailing the sound. He took us to go see some seals on the way back to the dock. We had a blast!

review.name: Best way to spend time on the water in Seattle!
review.reviewBody: Gorgeous boat, awesome captain (Captain Mark), and incredible views!! 10/10 would go sailing again with Candere Cruising again. I've rented through other companies and Cadere Cruising was top of the line, super responsive, and even worked with our group to find something that would work around our tight schedule.

review.name: Great tour of the Sound!
review.reviewBody: We had an amazing time on the Sound with Captain Russ. My wife and I enjoyed some wine and sandwiches we brought aboard while our captain gave us a wonderful tour. I would highly recommend booking this, and thank you Captain Russ again for the amazing afternoon!

review.name: Great group activity!
review.reviewBody: I booked a sunset cruise with Captain Russ as my fiancés birthday present, and had the best time. Captain Russ was friendly and informative as he answered our questions about the boat and about the Pudget Sound. We were onboard the Kingsley, and found it very comfortable, with a bathroom and plenty of seating. Captain Russell was able to show us a stunning sunset. I really appreciate his friendliness and expertise! 10/10 would recommend to anyone interested in having a nautical adventure in Washington!

review.name: Great Sail!
review.reviewBody: My wife and I booked a private sail trip with Captain Russ for a 3 hour day a sail on the Puget Sound.  The weather cooperated and the sight seeing was great.  Captain Russ told great stories and we had a great/relaxing sail.  Would highly recommend Candere Cruising!

itemListElement.name: Beneath The Streets Underground History Tour

name: Beneath The Streets Underground History Tour
description: Go underground on a 1-hour walking history tour through Seattle's original neighborhood.
