Our experienced guides lead small groups through, and beneath, Pioneer Square to the street level that existed in the 1890s. Explore underground pathways that were built more than 120 years ago, learning details on early Seattle history, why these spaces were built, and how they have been used (and misused) over the years. Marvel at how this once Indian encampment has since transformed into one of the 20 largest cities in the United States.

review.name: Sarah is awesome
review.reviewBody: Get Sarah as the guide - her enthusiasm is contagious. Interesting history and she tells it very well. Be prepared for 4 or 5 flights of steps (total over the tour, not all at once)

review.name: Don't miss that tour !
review.reviewBody: This visit was super fun and a lot good informations about seattle in a fun way. Don't miss that, to discover, view and have good time. The guide was super fun and gave us plenty of stories.

review.name: Informative, fun, interactive!
review.reviewBody: This was my second tour, the first being in March with Sarah, and most recently with Dave.  Both experiences were outstanding!  The groups are small and interactive, both guides were very knowledgeable and able to answer questions along the way.  Great tours, highly recommend.

review.name: Learn something new!
review.reviewBody:
A very interesting and comprehensive tour. Patti did a great job and was very active with the group. The small group
Of ten was very pleasant.

review.name: Best history tour of Seattle 😍
review.reviewBody:
I LOVED hearing the history of Seattle. I had no idea. Dave, our tour guide, was so knowledgeable. I asked so many questions our tour ran over by 15 minutes. I loved how interactive it was and all of the little details. I want to go back for the red light district tour. 

As a side note I highly recommend reading Chief Seattle's speech. The Internet says it might not be his words exactly but it's beautiful and makes me cry.

review.name: Great history lesson!
review.reviewBody:
The history was fascinating and guide was very knowledgeable with great stories.
The tunnels are cool but the history behind them and Seattle fire was interesting.
Thanks Dave our guide

review.name: The host was awesome and knew a lot of great info. Never knew any of the towns history before visiting. Very interesting
review.reviewBody: I thought the tour was very interesting and Jim our guide was very knowledgeable. The history of Seattle was surprising since I had no idea.

review.name: Brilliant Experience don't miss out
review.reviewBody: We had the Beneath The Streets Underground Tour with Dave. He was brilliant and was so informative and was happy to answer any questions. I would highly recommend this tour it is a must do if you are visiting seattle.

review.name: 10/10 would recommend!
review.reviewBody: This was so fun and exciting. Mike was amazing and had so much enthusiasm that it made me excited! It was really interesting to learn the darker side of history, especially in a town I’ve never been. Thanks Mike you were great!

review.name: Interesting History Lesson Underground!
review.reviewBody: Very interesting tour!   Our guide, Terrilynn was awesome!  So much energy and so much knowledge...  I found it very interesting to know the history of Seattle!

itemListElement.name: Roundtrip Private Transfer from Seattle Airport

name: Roundtrip Private Transfer from Seattle Airport
description: Enjoy convenient roundtrip private transportation between Seattle-Tacoma International Airport and your downtown hotel or cruise ship terminal (pier 66 & pier 91) in the comfort of a private air conditiond shuttle van.

itemListElement.name: The Butchart Gardens Day Trip from Seattle

name: The Butchart Gardens Day Trip from Seattle
description:
Cruise from downtown Seattle to downtown Victoria on the Clipper for a day of exploring the popular and world-famous The Butchart Gardens. 

Daily Schedule: 

Depart Seattle - 7:30 a.m./8:00 a.m. ^

Arrive in Victoria - 10:30 a.m. /10:45 a.m.

Depart for the Butchart Gardens from the Clipper’s Victoria terminal - 11:30 a.m. 

Arrive at The Butchart Gardens - 12:30 p.m.

Free time to explore The Butchart Gardens

Depart the Gardens for Victoria's Inner Harbour* - 3:00 p.m. -5:00 p.m. ^

(Please leave the Butchart Gardens 2 hours prior to your departure back to Seattle. Guests will be dropped off at the Fairmont Empress) 

Departs for Victoria for Seattle - 5:00 p.m. / 7:00 p.m. ^

Arrive in Seattle at 7:45 p.m./9:45 p.m.^ 

^Victoria Clipper departures and arrival times vary based on season and day of the week. Please contact tour provider for up-to-date schedule.

review.name: A rainbow of flowers
review.reviewBody: It remained beautiful as ever with Sunken Garden bloom and fountain — returning after twenty years. Cafe’s desserts and salads were great.

review.name: Terrible customer service from associates  and corporate
review.reviewBody: The boat trip was absolutely horrible we sat in the upper deck on our 3-day garden tour and visit to Victoria on our trip over there was over 100 empty seats and when I went to take pictures from the window seat I was told I could not sit there because I would have to pay for an upgrade we had already spent $900 plus per couple for this adventure the lady that said we couldn't sit there wasn't very nice about it so I emailed the company from the ship and evidently they didn't really seem to care at all with our experience so I would not recommend this ferry company to anyone very rude associates and as far as the company itself to them it's just about the money not the client so stay off this boat if you Don't want to end up with a bad experience like we received try another company!!!

review.name: Still Gorgeous in October
review.reviewBody: We thought it might be too late to see the beautiful colors on October 4th.  Not true!  The gardens were colorful and stunning.  The only thing not in bloom were the roses.  Still thousands of other flowers to enjoy!

review.name: Beautiful
review.reviewBody: We had a great day. The ride to Victoria was enjoyable. I was able to see the fin of an Orca whale. We upgraded our seats for $10, totally worth the price. It rained/drizzled half of the day. Despite the weather, Butchart Gardens are magnificient! I can't image what they would be like during Spring/Summer. We didn't have time to explore much of Victoria. If I was to do it over, I would spend the night in Victoria. Our bus driver did a nice job talking about the area. He made it clear as to when and where to meet the bus for the return trip. All in all a great day!

review.name: Magnificient
review.reviewBody: The Butchart Gardens is one of the most beautiful in the world. I was stunned by the explosion of colors. It's is magnificient!!!!

review.name: Fun, long day trip
review.reviewBody: All was smooth and on time with Ferry and bus.  Victoria and the gardens were beautiful.  The price wasn’t cheap, however buying the Gardens tour with the Ferry saved significant $$ than if you did it separately.  It was a long day, with arrival at ferry at 7am and back at 9:30pm...and with each leg of ferry ride about 3 hours, it was a tight amount of time in Victoria.  If we did it again, we’d probably spend the night.

review.name: Victoria
review.reviewBody: It was so beautiful. It was hard to absorb all the flowers. Would like to have stayed longer. Butchart Gardens were gorgeous.  We liked China town with the bonsai trees along the street. All the ships at the pier were so picturesque. We loved it.

review.name: Beautiful and amazing!
review.reviewBody: Doing this trip in all one day was really long.  Checked in at 6:30 am and got back into Seattle at 10:30.  However, the ferry ride was nice, saw a whale breaching, and visited with nice people around us.  The tour bus was very hot and we couldn’t hear the guide on the way to the gardens but coming back was much better.  The gardens made it all worth it as they were absolutely spectacular.

review.name: Overpriced
review.reviewBody:
Pros:
-Nothing to complain about with the ferry or bus ride
-Extremely friendly and knowledgeable driver
-Garden is beautiful

Cons:
-Extremely overpriced
-No time to explore city

Overall, decent trip. This is the most convenient way to get to Victoria and the Butchart Gardens from Seattle. If you are willing to spend to see the gardens, I'd recommend the  overnight tour. It's not much more expensive, and you have more time to enjoy the attractions.

review.name: Lovely trip, just a bit disorganized
review.reviewBody: The trip itself was lovely and I would do it again, however, the company needs to provide more information about how to obtain boarding passes and when/where to board especially as it pertains to return trips. Thank goodness, I arrived early and asked lots of questions.

itemListElement.name: Friday Harbor Day Trip & Whale Watching from Seattle

name: Friday Harbor Day Trip & Whale Watching from Seattle
description: Enjoy whale watching and a San Juan Island day trip from Seattle! This is the only cruise that leaves directly from downtown Seattle, allowing you to skip the traffic and get out on the water. With the guidance of a trained onboard naturalist, you will be taken to an area world-renowned for wildlife, where you will be on the lookout for orca, minke and humpback whales as well as Dall’s porpoise, seals, otters, bald eagles and more! Afterwards, you will have a stopover in Friday Harbor for a chance to grab a bite to eat or explore.

review.name: whale watching
review.reviewBody: This is a great way to see the whales.  They seem to know where the whales hang out and bring their customers to great viewing locations.  Even if there are not a lot of whales that day it is a nice cruise with beautiful scenery.  It is worth taking the time to see

review.name: We got "mugged" by a whale!
review.reviewBody:
An excellent day trip! The pre-boarding for families with small children really made our day. The vessel is clean and comfy. I recommend seats in the first level (of three) at the front.
The highlight of the trip was an unplanned up-close whale encounter. Even without that the trip would have still been very worth it. Do bring a good pair of binoculars (or rent them on-board) as the ship is not allowed to get to close to the whales.

review.name: Boats cancelled with no notice!
review.reviewBody:
This is one of the most disappointing travel arrangements I have ever experienced. I booked months in advance through Clipper to take the ferry from Seattle to Friday Harbor on the morning of Friday 9/21, followed immediately by a whale watching tour, 2 nights at a hotel, and then the ferry back from Friday Harbor to Seattle on Sunday night.

I showed up on Friday morning ready for a relaxing trip only to be told that the bus was waiting for me. However, my package included no bus travel. To my disappointment the company advised me that the boat was out of service (and had been for about 5 weeks). They stated that they decided on Monday to cancel the Friday sailing, and sent an email about this. However I received their prior confirmation email, but no cancellation email. They also said they left a message and sent a text the day before - but apparently they sent that to my home phone instead of cell phone by accident.

Long story short, on Friday morning our choices were cancel the trip or take a 90 minutes bus to Anacortes, have a 2 hour wait at Anacortes, take the ferry to Friday Harbor and reschedule the Whale Watching tour for Sunday. So, we agreed to this - though this is not what we wanted or had planned - and made the best of the trip there. At this point we were told that the boat would be back in service on Sunday and that we would have no issue with the last chance at whale watching or the ferry back to Seattle.

On Sunday morning we were scheduled to meet at 12noon for the Whale Watching tour. At 8:30am I get a text message saying this and the direct ferry back to Seattle were cancelled. There is now no reschedule option for the Whale Watching, and we'll be getting back to Seattle until about 3 hours after we were scheduled.

Overall, Friday Harbor was great... but I would NEVER trust Clipper with my vacation plans again. Customer service was great to help provide some refunds, but no refund can replace the opportunity for Whale Watching when you aren't a local to the area.

review.name: They cancelled on us BOTH WAYS
review.reviewBody: I was excited to take a direct ferry from Seattle to the San Juan Islands and booked the whole trip around it - from where we stayed in Seattle to our activities on the Islands.  I was very disappointed when a few days before our 9/21 departure we received an email that the ferry was cancelled.  The alternative transportation option was a grumpy bus ride to Anacortes and walking on the ferry to Friday Harbor (Tix are $13pp) with a 50% refund for this leg.  We would have been better off renting a car from Seattle and skipping Clipper all together but we believed them when they promised that ferry would be up and running for our trip back on 9/23.  Guess what, at 10am on 9/23 we receive a text update that the clipper ferry is cancelled due to mechanical issues.  We opted not to take the alternative transportation putting us in Seattle 3 hours after the time we were supposed to arrive on the ferry.  Instead we booked a flight and it was a dream.  Skip this ferry, go for the flight.

review.name: Fantastic! Orcas in the wild!
review.reviewBody: I booked my trip easily online. Easy to find Pier 69 - its the last one on the pier! I have no complaints at all for the entire trip. Snacks and drinks available on the boat. Dropped of some people in Friday Harbor and then off to look for whales - which we found! amazing to see them out in the wild. Spent 30 minutes watching them before returning to Friday Harbor for lunch.  Had to go the longer way back due to the weather. Its a very long day - but totally worth it

review.name: TERRIBLE Customer Service
review.reviewBody: Clipper vacations cancelled and rescheduled our whale watching trip 3 times in a row, offering 50% off to reschedule. The problem is they kept cancelling the trip and offering diminishing returns of half of half of half etc. After the 4th reschedule I feel the trip should just be free but they really want to hang on to those $25. Completely blew my mind.

review.name: Long Day
review.reviewBody: From start to finish the day lasted 13 hours.  The boat was very crowded which didn't afford us the opportunity to change seats when the volume reached a level that we couldn't hear the very informative naturalist on board.We spent an hour  viewing the whales. (took a while to find them).

review.name: Would Have Liked Clearer Communication
review.reviewBody: My husband and I were part of the group of reviewers whose trip was cancelled because of issues with the ship. While it's totally understandable that the company doesn't want to take passengers out into an unsafe situation, I wish we would have been told in advance that the whale watching portion of the trip was cancelled. We did receive both an email and text message (excellent communication) the afternoon before the trip - the message implied that one part of the trip would be cancelled but that they would still provide a bus to the harbor. The message also said they were going to refund the first part of the trip (again, solid business practice). We mistakenly thought we would just miss the sightseeing portion but still get to see whales during the second portion near the harbor. When we got to the pier the next morning, we were then told that the whale watching portion of the trip was cancelled. This left us reeling trying to figure out what to do that day and very disappointed. The employee at the desk was friendly and told us to explain to the parking attendant what happened but we were still charged $5 to park by the pier. ($5 not being a big deal obviously, but it did feel like a little slap in the face in the moment.) To avoid this confusion in the future I would recommend making the messages a little clearer that the whale watching portion of the trip is not going to take place despite being taken to the harbor and to somehow make sure customers don't have to pay for parking.

review.name: Cancelled!
review.reviewBody: The Wednesday 7/25/18) trip was cancelled less than 24 hours before the scheduled time. We called to see if we could re-schedule for Thursday or Friday- of course they were fully booked. We were told there was no availability until mid-August. Yep, we’ll just hop on the plane right back up here from Dallas no problem! AND they didn’t have any suggestions for other companies that could possibly accommodate us -  that would go a long way towards customer service. Luckily we found another whale watching trip out of Edmonds and had a great time.

review.name: Cancelled without any notice!!!
review.reviewBody:
Extremely disappointed with our experience with Clipper Vacations. Our San Juan trip was cancelled without us being notified at all. We arrived at the pier at 6:50am to see on the departure screen that the San Juan trip was cancelled. The agent explained that we should have received an email, text, or voicemail notifying us; however, we did not receive anything. In fact we were even able to check in online and print our boarding passes just the night before. They were not able to explain why their system was still able to allow us to do that. However, with regards to the cancellation notice, they claim that they have no contact information in their system. We found that very odd because we were still able to receive our confirmation email before and we had given them our email address and phone number when we booked over the phone. In fact, we booked over the phone because when we called to ask for more information about the San Juan trip, we were told that their online booking system tends to have problems. From our experience, their phone booking system seem equally flawed. Nevertheless, our main dissatisfaction was that there was no notice what so ever for the cancellation; not even an alert or anything on their website. How would anyone know if they were not able to be contacted? We had to arrange a vacation day with our workplace in order to make this trip, but that seemed to have been done for nothing.

Ultimately, Clipper Vacations needs to improve their online system. We are at least grateful that we were told we would get a full refund (hopefully); however, we are extremely disappointed with our experience with Clipper Vacations.

itemListElement.name: Cooking Class in Pike Place Market

name: Cooking Class in Pike Place Market
description:
This cooking class experience consists of a tour through the famous Pike Place Market where the chef will explain the local and seasonal produce as he/she selects the ingredients for the menu being cooked. The group ends up in the beautiful Atrium kitchen in the market where the chef instructs the preparation of the menu; providing tips on cooking techniques, information about the meal and tidbits of Seattle’s history. We then sit down to indulge in our gourmet dishes. All ingredients used are sourced in the Northwest. The menus are thoughtfully designed to learn new techniques, maximize seasonal flavors and inspire your inner-chef to replicate these recipes at home.

The format of this class is a combination of hands-on and demonstration to ensure that our guests get the most of the teachings and those that would like to participate can do so. We understand that some people want to relax and some want to be active. It's works well for both.

review.name: Pop-Up Cooking Class!
review.reviewBody:
Such a fun experience with Chef Liz! I had booked the market tour and cooking class for April, but due to COVID it was canceled.  Super excited when Liz emailed and let me know she would be doing some pop-up classes with a smaller group and I picked to learn how to make Halibut and Panzanella.

As a Seattleite, I hit the local markets often to get seafood and vegetables.  I do most of my meals at home and love to cook!  Liz showed me some new tricks and techniques that I will use in my day to day cooking.

The Panzanella salad will now be on repeat all summer long too!

I love that this was a small group (5 of us!) and Liz made sure we were all safe. She wore a face shield and we were all spaced out.

The group was fun and we were all locals, but anyone coming from out of town should absolutely take this class! You will learn new tips and tricks that you will be able to take home to your kitchen to utilize in your day to day cooking.

Thank you Chef Liz! I will definitely take more of your classes in the future!

review.name: Great experience with Chef Liz and team!
review.reviewBody:
We had a great experience with Eat Seattle at a recent cooking class and market tour! Liz and her staff are pleasant to be around and knowledgeable about the market. 

Picked up some knife skills and cooking tips as well. The three course meal, including king salmon was delicious! Thank you and looking forward to trying another class soon.

review.name: Fun Cooking Class in the Market
review.reviewBody: Really enjoyed this mini-tour of the market and cooking class! Chef and helpers were informative, friendly and entertaining. The food was delicious and they made sure to keep our wine glasses full throughout. A fun class for locals and visitors alike!

name: Sunset Cruise on Lake Union
description: Cruise in the lap of luxury aboard ‘Candére’ during a 3-hour sunset tour on Lake Union. Glide past floating homes and get a good look at Seattle-area highlights including the Space Needle, Gas Works Park, Husky Stadium, and — on a clear day — Mt. Rainier to the south of Lake Washington. With a cocktail in hand, you'll pass by drawbridges, seaplanes, and locals enjoying the lake by kayak while the sun sets.

review.name: Wonderful! Would go again!
review.reviewBody: Dylan was a wonderful tour guide! We were able to ride on his Bayliner, which allowed us to sit on the upper level. We appreciated the corny jokes, slew of information, and refreshing drinks! He also was super pucntual! We were back at exactly 9:00pm.  I would recommend this company again for a tour. I would also recommend to show up early so you can use the restroom in the diver's institute.

review.name: Wonderful way to spend the evening
review.reviewBody: My husband, myself and our son were in Seattle for a vacation from NC and wanted something different to do.  This cruise was the best ever.  Captain Benjamin was informative and made the trip very special for all of us. We would definitely do this again.  Thanks for a great was to spend Summer Solstice 2019.

itemListElement.name: The Art Of The Brick at Pacific Science Center

name: The Art Of The Brick at Pacific Science Center
description:
Limited engagement! On view in Seattle until September 11, 2016 Pacific Science Center is thrilled to host The Art of the Brick - the world's largest display of LEGO art featuring original pieces as well as re-imagined versions of the world's most famous art masterpieces like Van Gogh's Starry Night and Da Vinci's Mona Lisa. 

Admission includes access to all of Pacific Science Center's permanent exhibits including the Tropical Butterfly House, Professor Wellbody's Academy of Health and Wellness and many more!

Uncover the magic of science with your kids at the Pacific Science Center in Seattle. Located near the city’s famous Space Needle, the Pacific Science Center is the perfect play for hands on adventure for visitors of all ages.

name: Deactivated Wine Tour
description:
One of the best times of year to visit Mount Rainier is in the winter months. When the days get shorter, the summer crowds head home, and the park turns into a true winter wonderland, come visit Longmire in Mount Rainier National Park!

Stroll through the old-growth forests, where Douglas fir, hemlock, and cedar trees dwarf visitors. The bubbling natural springs tell a story of what lies beneath this abundant and volatile landscape. Experience the natural silence that takes hold as the snow dusted trees insulate the world around you. Learn the diverse history the Longmire area and how this region has attracted visitors long before it was a national park.

After arriving at Mt. Rainier, you will get out to experience as much of the Longmire area as possible for the day. Explore beyond the vehicle during walks and hikes with your guide by your side the entire time. If conditions call for snowshoes, your guide will provide an introductory lesson on how to stay safe and enjoy your walk.

review.name: Above and Beyond
review.reviewBody: We were so fortunate as to get Jann, a professional photographer with a background in teaching English! (Hint hint: makes for some great pics and storytelling) She was honest and passionate about her job and the wilderness but down to earth and did everything she could to make our trip special (despite my forgetting to mention before the trip that is was both of our birthdays) The Snoqualmie falls walk is VERY short so don’t choose this one if you’re looking for a hike but do choose this one if you are looking to drink a lot of very nice wines and get very toasty. We were planning on going out to dinner afterwards but they provided us with such a bounty of dry snacks, fresh locally sourced lunch, and drinks that by the time we were dropped back at the hotel we were much too alcohol soaked and full to do so. Well worth the price! In fact an Uber all the way there and back from Seattle as well as all that we consumed very well may have cost us not much less! Thank you Jann and thank you Evergreen escapes!

review.name: Wonderful and beginner friendly!
review.reviewBody: Despite being quite new to wine in general, I had a lovely time with my mom and aunt on this tour! The falls were gorgeous and we got to taste a variety of wines. There were snacks and water bottles to borrow for the day as well which were both a nice touch. Thank you to our amazing tour guide Kris Parfitt! :)

name: Seattle Grand 4-Hour City Tour
description: Explore the Emerald City on our grand 4-hour tour of Seattle. Experience the vibrant tastes and sights of Seattle, while exploring distinct neighborhoods such as Chinatown and catch the perfect views from Queen Ann Hill. This public tour provides an excellent overview of Central Seattle from a comfortable bus with large viewing windows. Our tour stops at least four times throughout the excursion. We allow you to get out some on foot to explore as we believe it helps in experiencing the city and neighborhoods properly. We only offer one tour a day so we thrive on making ours the most complete tour of Seattle without you feeling like you're being hurried. Another great benefit is there is NO extra charge to be picked up at 90 percent of Seattle hotels- we are the ONLY tour company to offer this benefit- GRATIS! IF PREARRANGED IN ADVANCE we can even offer drop-offs at Cruise Ports for an EXTRA FEE after the tour ends (AFTER 2:30pm).

review.name: Seattle touring with Joe
review.reviewBody: What a day!  The weather was amazing, and our tour guide Joe was outstanding. Navigating Seattle streets with its hodgepodge of construction and road closures is a feat in itself.  But Joe provided a steady narration of the different buildings as we passed on our way to various sites. He shared researched information about the neighborhoods we were seeing. Pioneer Square was wonderful with stops at the Glassblowing Studio, UPS tribute park, and the Klondike Gold Rush Museum. Of course there is never enough time (or parking) when at Pike Place Market as the sights and sounds are plentiful—just a people watcher’s paradise. Too many choices in a really short time! We watched a ship traverse part of the Ballard Locks and took in the high up views from the Queen Anne overlooks. We’d completely forgotten about the Fremont Troll, and Joe brought us up to date on the Fremont Summer Solstice Celebration. We will definitely recommend a tour with Joe to friends visiting Seattle. He was generous with his time and knowledge and allowed for slower walkers, bathroom breaks, and extra photo opportunities. We haven’t even mentioned the Space Needle, the stadiums, the architecture, or the Seattle artwork. It was an all inclusive experience!

review.name: So much fun!!
review.reviewBody: Mark was hands down the absolute best tour guide. He was so fun and made this vacation amazing! My mom and I saw so many local attractions all while playing a trivia game with Mark! Highly recommended tour!

review.name: Joe told interesting stories while showing us the city
review.reviewBody: We were a very small tour (three visitors), but fortunately the tour wasn’t cancelled.  Joe was our guide and picked us up promptly at our hotels. He offered us bottled water so we didn’t need to bring any.   We enjoyed our intimate tour of Seattle and were entertained by Joe’s running commentary.  We had plenty of time at Pikes Market to buy lunch. We were very fortunate that the weather was outstanding, blue skies and views from Mount Rainier to Mount Hood.

review.name: Great overview of Seattle
review.reviewBody: As first-time visitors, this tour provided us with an excellent overview of Seattle. Mark was an excellent guide & provided lots of fun and interesting info.

review.name: Great tour
review.reviewBody: Very enjoyable tour even with the rainy conditions. Joe was a knowledgeable and friendly guide. Saw many Seattle sites.

review.name: Highly recommend this tour!
review.reviewBody: The tour was great.  My cousin, a Seattle resident, was amazed, when I told him about it,  at how many sights we covered in a short time.  If we had stayed longer we would have returned to several of the sites we passed.  Lucinda was a great guide with lots of history and other information but also did not talk non-stop or tell silly jokes, which I can find annoying. So my daughter and I truly enjoyed the experience.

review.name: Greatest Tour of Seattle Washington-Highly recommended
review.reviewBody: James Gunn was the tour guide extraordinaire! He took us to all the major highlights of Seattle and provided great historical facts about each site. He is kind, patient, highly intelligent, and obviously loves people and his job! It was amazing!

review.name: Seattle tour.
review.reviewBody: Nice tour of the city excellent and knowledgeable tour guide! Several stops for pictures and bathroom breaks. He also provided snacks.

review.name: Mark is amazing!
review.reviewBody: Mark was our guide and he was amazing!  Tour was fun and informative. Take his advice on places to eat.  Mark is very personable and happy to answer all questions.

review.name: Great Experience!
review.reviewBody: Highly highly recommend! Mark was our tour guide and he did such an amazing tour! So fun! Very informative and saw many sights I would now have been able to find on my own.

itemListElement.name: Seattle Craft Distillery Tour with Tastings

name: Seattle Craft Distillery Tour with Tastings
description:
Get a unique taste of Seattle on this tour to some of the city's most exclusive local distilleries. Travel by luxury Mercedes-Benz to three small-batch craft distilleries to meet the distillers and get the inside scoop on the city’s liquor production, from the Prohibition to today. Sample a craft cocktail and more than 12 locally produced liquors including gin, vodka and whiskey, and pair your libations with artisanal bites made by award-winning chefs. 
This small-group tour is limited to 10 people, ensuring you’ll receive personalized attention from your entertaining and knowledgeable guide.

review.name: Great time had by all - perfect idea for a birthday!
review.reviewBody: I booked tickets on the Speakeasy Distillery Tour for my boyfriend's 26th birthday for myself, him, and all his friends. We were in a comfy Mercedes bus, given a craft cocktail (yum!) to start out journey. We explored three different distilleries, each time coming back to a different snack or cocktail when we boarded the bus. I would definitely do this again!

review.name: Do something different!
review.reviewBody: After doing tons of winery and brewery tours we tried this tour.  We did not know that Seattle was the leading craft distillery city in the US.  There were six of us on the tour. We traveled in a very comfortable modern small bus.  We were greeted with a very excellent cocktail in a small mason jar.  Yum!  We went to three small distilleries where we were thoroughly enlightened about the distilling process and their products as well as tasting ALL their products.  After the first distillery we were greeted back at the bus with a small dish on local sausage and sauerkraut.  Yum!  Between two and three we were treated to another small cocktail and a delicious cupcake.  All in all, they did a very classy job all the way.  Sounds like a lot of booze but it really wasn't.  This is not a "party cruise".  We took the "happy hour" tour which is on Fridays at 2:45 pm.

review.name: Great way to start the weekend!
review.reviewBody: My husband and I did the TGIF Happy Hour Tour.  It was fun and informative.  We were provided with transportation along with a cheerful knowledgeable guide.  We visited 3 distilleries and each shared different knowledge about the industry as well as their delicious libations.  We even received snacks and drinks as we drove from distillery to distillery.  We would definitely do this again!

review.name: Fun afternoon outing
review.reviewBody: We did the happy hour tour from 2:45- 5ish (it went a little long) and had a great time. We started out with a cocktail on our way to the first distillery and played fun prohibition era music in the car. My husband and I had a great time, tasted some delicious spirits, and gained a new appreciation for the art of craft liquors.

review.name: One of the Most Underrated Things To Do in Seattle
review.reviewBody: Local Craft offers a one of a kind tour in Seattle that is not only a ton of fun, but super informative on the craft distilling movement. Very cool to hear from three local distillers on their own personal passions, taste their booze and enjoy some tasty snacks from LCT while they whisk you across Seattle. Great for couples, small groups and probably an amazing corporate team event if you booked the whole van, which I think seats about 10 people.

review.name: A Definite To-Do!
review.reviewBody: If you want a fun, delicious touring experience, DEFINITELY take the Seattle Speakeasy Distillery Tour. The first benefit is obviously someone driving you from distillery to distillery so you don't have to worry about someone in your party being the DD, but through that activity, you get to stop by a handful of fantastic distilleries in the area, see how their products are made, and sample some delicious vodkas, gins, whiskeys and more along the way. Plus, as an added bonus, you receive a couple handmade cocktails en route to the distilleries, AND yummy local snacks. This is a definite must-do in the area, and something that I, as a resident, will be going on again

review.name: Fun!
review.reviewBody: Our driver Eric was awesome! Great tour of local craft with lots of variety! They made great drinks and food between visits for us to enjoy. Thanks for showing us around!

review.name: Disappointing
review.reviewBody:
We were excited to take the tour. Having been on 2 other food tours and enjoying them thoroughly, we thought this would be similar. Not at all. The tour guide offered no information or background on any of the distilleries. The first and last distillery visits were fun and filled with detail and tastes. 
The middle one was not on the itinerary. The distillery rep had a chip on his shoulder and bad mouthed the other distilleries on the tour. This distillery was dirty and not worth the stop. 
The snacks were pretty good. The Sprinter bus was comfortable. 
The bartender kit was a glass shaker and shot glass in a cute paper bag. It fell short of what a "kit" would usually consist of. 
I guess we expected more.

review.name: Top of the Line Entertainment!
review.reviewBody: Who would have thought Seattle has an acclaimed production of really fine spirits! Isadora, our guide, and the distillery folks were very knowledgeable and provided a wealth of information, not to mention the numerous, liberal samplings of fantastic spirits!!! Definitely a tour for any occasion!  I was pleasantly surprised the tour was much, much than I expected!

review.name: Amazing Tour
review.reviewBody: For the price, this is an amazing tour. Our tour guide, Isadora, was entertaining, interesting, and pleasant.  We had so much fun tasting the craft cocktails and local snacks in the van as well as learning and tasting at the distilleries. Highly recommended!

itemListElement.name: Boeing Factory and Future of Flight Aviation Center Tour from Seattle

name: Boeing Factory and Future of Flight Aviation Center Tour from Seattle
description: The Boeing Factory Tour takes you for an extraordinary behind-the-scenes look at large airliner manufacturing and the amazing face of future commercial aviation. Ride in comfort to Boeing’s massive factory in Everett, by volume the largest building in the world! From high above the Boeing Factory floor, you’ll view the assembly of Boeing’s wide-body airplanes – the 747, 777 and the technologically advanced 787 Dreamliner.

review.name: Museum of the past brings back the memories
review.reviewBody: We arrived late so only spent 2 hours there but its Awesome. So many Historic Planes and Space equipment inside and out. Experienced staff at hand to answer all your questions and so many really good exhibits. would love to go again.

review.name: 疫情影響，現在只能在館內活動，不能看製造飛機過程
review.reviewBody: 雖然因為疫情的關係不能坐巴士參觀飛機製造過程，只能到頂樓看看造好的飛機停在外面的飛機場，運氣好的話可以看到飛機試飛以及離開，我們當天買票是買一送一，因為人真的很少，先帶我們進入一個大廳看ppt，解說人員非常幽默，再來就到旁邊看飛機的零件或是買紀念品，就這樣，難怪觀光客稀少。

review.name: Tickets should not be sold for this museum until it is rebuilt
review.reviewBody: we only went to the future of flight aviation center as the factory was not available. The exhibition is in one small space only and most of the exhibits are closed. The interactive areas were being rebuilt or closed for future staff training.  You can see some factory buildings  across the runway but no member of staff was prepared to come on to the viewing platform ( roof) to tell us what we were looking at. Extremely disappointing and tickets should not be sold for an exhibition in this state.

review.name: Informative and interesting tour.
review.reviewBody: This tour was fantastic. Our tour guide Frankie was so informative and friendly. Would highly recommend seeing how these incredible machines are manufactured. Only downside is not able to take photos but can understand why.

review.name: Great
review.reviewBody: Our guide was full of knowledge, it was such an easy tour.  Picked up at our hotel, we could wander around the Future of Flight Museum while we waited for the actual tour.  Tour itself was great, guide was fabulous and full of knowledge.  You are pushed through a little like sheep but there is enough time at each place to see what there is to see.

review.name: Fun tour
review.reviewBody: This tour is awesome. Learning and seeing how boeing plans are made is awesome. Factory is huge and would never imagine boeing employing so many!

review.name: Fantastic visit
review.reviewBody: Really interesting with lots of information on the airline industry and a greater understanding of aviation history.

review.name: Awesome visit to Boeing, great tour guide
review.reviewBody: With customized tours through tripadvisor we booked the Boeing tour. A must do! Great guide Mark picked us up at the hotel and immediately gave us lots of info on Seattle, he is a great entertainer. Next to that being in the gigantic Boeing factory, seeing the miraculous logistical challenges building their planes, was simply awesome. Again a must do when in Seattle! And worth every penny.

review.name: Interesting
review.reviewBody: It was very interesting to see the facility although with the number of people and tours that visit, your time actually viewing the manufacturing site is a little limited. We were picked up in town transported to the site, given a short introduction and safety brief then bused to the plant. The tour is reasonable informative although time to ask detailed questions is limited. The Future of Flight occurs after the factory tour. This tour does not include the History of Flight facility. Our driver did give us an informative chat about Seattle to and from the hotel where we were picked up.

review.name: Last minute
review.reviewBody: We ended up doing the Boeing trip with these guys booked via Colin our concierge at the edgewater booked very last minute driver picked us up at the hotel nice drive to the Boeing factory had quite a few stories to tell us really interesting guy on the way back to Seattle knew all the shortcuts to miss the really bad traffic would use again

itemListElement.name: Christmas Lights Leavenworth Tour from Seattle

name: Christmas Lights Leavenworth Tour from Seattle
description:
Christmas in Leavenworth, Washington is amazing and you will love this premium tour to get there and back. Not just a ride, you'll learn about the beautiful scenery you see,and get hands-on details on what to do in Leavenworth, where to go, and more!

Raffle prizes, map, holiday trivia, word games, singing, or just enjoy the ride!

name: The Blue Glass
description: A great neighborhood gastropub off the beaten path in Seattle's Ballard area. Serving globally inspired comfort food & drink 7 days a week.

name: Ba Bar Capitol Hill
description: Specialties Ba Bar is the place for authentic Vietnamese cuisine in Seattle. We use the highest quality ingredients to create the best Pho in town. We also have one of the top selections of high end spirits on Capitol Hill and we make a great Moscow Mule to boot. Bonus - we serve food until 1:30am on weeknights and 3:30am on weekends. History Established in 2011. Sophie and Eric Banh grew up together eating street food in Saigon, and that was really the inspiration for Ba Bar. When they first opened Monsoon Seattle in 1999, they drew much of their inspiration from the very same "street food" we are serving. With Ba Bar we're just a little closer to the street. But yeah, same owners. Same chefs. Same commitment to quality. And did you know, Ba means father and number 3 in Vietnamese?

itemListElement.name: 4-Day Pacific Northwest National Parks Tour from Seattle

name: 4-Day Pacific Northwest National Parks Tour from Seattle
description: Travel by ferry across the shimmering waters of the Emerald City of Seattle, and through the lush green rainforests of Olympic National Park in a comfortable mini-coach. Then journey through old growth forests, around rustic logging towns, and across mighty rivers into the charming city of Portland. From the rugged and windswept shores of Washington and Oregon’s Pacific coast to the towering majesty of Mount Rainier National Park, this three night/four day trip is an adventurer's dream.

review.name: Best
review.reviewBody:
Team Incredible Adventures were super organized with excellent communication from the very beginning. JD and Jolie worked to make sure the tour was set up as planned!

Jill is the most amazing tour guide! She checked in ahead of time with tips and pointers. She knew exactly which trails would reveal breathtaking vistas and all the extra little places which makes this region so special. I learnt not only about the region but some super useful hiking tips for my next time on the trail. She kept things on schedule without it being rushed with plenty time to enjoy and take pictures. In addition, when hurricane Dorian on the east coast meant I had to adjust my travel plans she coordinated seamlessly with the team to ensure that we could still maximize the trip! The tour felt like an amazing sight seeing trip with family!!

The 4 day tour is the best way to get an overview of as much as possible. Since the tour moves from place to place there is no time wasted driving back and forth to home base. Also, the option to have a private tour allowed for customization so from Bainbridge there was a visit to the cute little Nordic town of Poulsbo and then on to the beauty of Olympic Park with crescent lake and hoh rain forest. I was able to get my Twilight fix an can attest that the pizza in Forks in yummy! Astoria had the best seafood of my entire trip and Mt Rainier was breathtaking. From enchanted forests to mountain vistas straight out of sound of music and quaint friendly historic towns this tour has it all. 

Thanks so much Jill and team incredible adventures. Cheers!

review.name: Great trip with our guide Eric !
review.reviewBody:
An excellent way to see Seattle, Olympic National Park, Astoria, Portland Mt. Ranier and interesting stops along the way like the T Dairy.   Saw and hiked beautiful mountains, forests and beaches .  Also good accomodations walks and restaurants in the towns/cities.  Eric did a really good job of guiding whether it be hiking, driving, restaurants, history & local knowledge. 
Only thing I'd change personally is to skip Portland or Port Angels and spend and extra day hiking arond Mt. Ranier or other Nat'l Park.

itemListElement.name: 6-Day Northern Pacific Coast Adventure Tour from Seattle to San Francisco

name: 6-Day Northern Pacific Coast Adventure Tour from Seattle to San Francisco
description: After meeting your guide in downtown Seattle, start your journey heading off to Mount Rainier National Park and arriving in our night stop, the City of Roses, Portland. Next up, catch sight of the impressive Mount Hood, before heading to the Northwest’s adventure capital, Bend, Oregon. Two fun-fueled days await you in Bend! Whether you’re into rafting, biking, hiking or horseback riding, Bend has you covered! Up next, head south to the crystal clear waters of Oregon’s crown jewel, Crater Lake National Park! After a stay in quirky Grants Pass, you’ll head down the rugged Pacific Coast in northern California and get up close and personal with the towering coastal redwoods. Finally, you’ll make your way down through California’s world-famous Napa Wine Country before catching sight of the City by the Bay, San Francisco!

itemListElement.name: Mt. Rainier and Mount St. Helens Volcano Tour by Plane

name: Mt. Rainier and Mount St. Helens Volcano Tour by Plane
description: This incredible 90 minute scenic flight tour from Seattle flies you around Mount Rainier and  Mount St. Helens getting you up close and personal with Rainier's 25 glaciers - the largest collection of permanent ice on a single US mountain south of Alaska.  From your window aboard our 10-passenger Caravan wheel-plane, you'll also have the perfect vantage of Mount St. Helens' 2 mile wide crater.

review.name: Jaw dropping volcano tour from Seattle!
review.reviewBody:
Posting since I was searching high and low for reviews on the mountain volcano hike to Mt. Rainier and Mt. Saint Helens!

A lovely super unique and unforgettable tour. Seeing these mountains up close was absolutely unreal. I’m still processing it. You also get a great view from both sides of the plane because they turn around. I sat on the left side and I think that is the best side to be on imo!

Pilot was super nice and even took a selfie with us. 

I do wish there was a tour guide there to give facts and history on the mountains and Washington’s nature in general. After a while you’re just looking out the window which is fine but some kind of live or prerecorded audio for a guided tour would be great. Also I suggest bringing ear plugs for the noise but not sure if that’s unsafe or not.

If you’re not good on rollercoasters the ascend and descend will be roughhhh, but you’ll be okay once it’s in cruise control it’ll feel like you’re on a couch lol.

A great birthday gift to my brother!

review.name: trip to mt. ranier
review.reviewBody: tour was great...pickup was on time...our guide was very good...had lots of info...the weather wasn't so great....fog  and drizzle on the mountain...but thats how it goes....We would advise anyone to take this tour....its a whole day and well worth it

review.name: Fantastic Experience!
review.reviewBody: We did the Mt. Ranier and Mt. St. Helen's Volcano Tour -- 90 minutes, and the scenery was breathtaking. The pilot flew to Mt. Ranier, and went almost all the way around it, did a U-turn so everyone could get teh same view, then headed to Mt. St. Helens and flew the same kind of route.  The areas of devastation took me back to the photos I remember seeing in 1980.  If you go for this trip, take advantage of the free earplugs that are available inside the doors just before you head out to the tarmac.  It's loud on the plane!

review.name: Pricey but Worth It
review.reviewBody: Seeing two of the Northwest's iconic peaks from above but up close is a special experience. We've made the drive to Mt. Rainier and Mt. Saint Helen's numerous times and we have seen them countless times flying into and out of SeaTac Airport; they are impressive sites, for sure. But flying just a few hundred feet above offers another level of appreciation of their magnitude and splendor. So if you can afford it, this flight is definitely worth the price. The route makes passes around the mountains in both directions so all passengers get a great look. The aircraft is a nine-passenger one with wings above the fuselage so all windows provide good site-lines. The space is comfortable enough for a 90-minute flight. There is no narration, however, so I suggest printing out a bit of information or a map to help identify parts of the mountains, other peaks, rivers and lakes. Mt. Hood, Mt. Adams, the Cowlitz and Toutle Rivers are all clearly visible.

itemListElement.name: One-Way Seattle Private Transfer up to 12 Pax: Cruises, Sea-Tac, Hotels

name: One-Way Seattle Private Transfer up to 12 Pax: Cruises, Sea-Tac, Hotels
description:
A One-Way Private Transfer service for small groups up to 14 that require transfer between any of the following two points on a single day of travel: Sea-Tac Airport, Seattle’s cruise terminals (Pier 91 or Pier 66) and any location in the Greater Seattle area, such as a downtown Seattle hotel. 

This is an ideal option for cruise passengers who require a simple transfer between Sea-Tac airport or downtown Seattle and their cruise ship. This transfer service is provided between 2 points in the greater Seattle area on a single day of travel. Larger groups may be accommodated with multiple vehicles, but please contact us before placing a booking to ensure that we have sufficiently large vehicles for your group. 

Our vehicle has capacity for up to 20 pieces of luggage with our optional add-on luggage trailer.

review.name: Fabulous Day
review.reviewBody: Easily one of the best experiences ever, from booking to the end of the tour. They were quick to respond to all emails and text messages. When I inquired about breakfast options as we were all arriving on early flights they offered a continental breakfast at our first stop. Michael arrived right on que at the airport and we were off! Our first stop was Kerry Park with fabulous views of the city and a perfect place for our impromptu breakfast. The tour was everything we wanted and more! I would highly recommend them!

itemListElement.name: CitySightseeing Seattle Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour + Bookable Extras

name: CitySightseeing Seattle Hop-On Hop-Off Bus Tour + Bookable Extras
description: Experience the best of Seattle on a fantastic City Sightseeing bus tour! With the unlimited hop-on hop-off feature, you can explore the city at your own pace for 24 or 48 hours. Discover the key landmarks, including the world famous Space Needle, Pioneer & Occidental Square, Chinatown, Seattle Central Library, Capitol Hill, Pike Place Market and much more! There's also an audio tour commentary provided in English so that you can learn all about the history as you cruise around. With the All About Seattle Pass you'll also enjoy access to the Scenic Seattle panoramic tour, on which you'll experience unrivalled views of Seattle's most picturesque spots. You'll also enjoy a walking tour for an immersive look at the local culture. Book the Seattle Night Tour to discover Seattle after dark and learn interesting facts about the city and it's landmarks with a live guide. You'll also have chance to take plenty of snaps with frequent photo stops along the way!

review.name: No Customer Service!!
review.reviewBody: We had an emergency and I tried to cancel hop on bus trip one day before tour. I left several messages and did not receive call back. Tour operator charged me regardless.

review.name: Easy way to discover Seattle
review.reviewBody: I had a nice experience with the CitySightseeing Seattle hop-on hop-off bus service. It was the convenient way to explore the city at my own pace. The route covered all the major landmarks in downtown, and the audio commentary was both informative and engaging. The buses were punctual, and the staff was friendly and helpful throughout the day. Whether you’re a first-time visitor or just looking to see Seattle from a new perspective, I recommend this service.

review.name: Costly badly operated tour
review.reviewBody:
Joined this bus tour at the needle. First off bus driver was loud and obnoxious/overbearing. The tour, no headphones on this trip just a speaker in the middle of the top floor, so when   people start talking(annoyingly loudly) you can't hear a thing, not that that mattered as everything that was broadcasted was one stop behind us. We were told not to move around the bus unless at a complete stop, no stop buttons upstairs that we could see,  so we waited for the bus to stop at a designated HOHOff stop, bus driver stopped for a few seconds and drove on. Very frustrating. Why aren't the stop announced and stopped at for at least enough time to get down the stairs and off. This was the dearest tour we've ever done, a one day pass cost the same as a three day pass in Rome. 
1 star as I can't give 0 🤬🤬🤬🤬

review.name: Not worth the stress
review.reviewBody: Currently on the 1hr20min loop and having used these all over the world this is the worst one ever.  No headset means you have to listen to everyone talk and cannot hear about the city.  Probably most expensive too. Not happy

review.name: Good time
review.reviewBody: We had a good time.  Convenient stops.  Sometimes they forgot to turn the the audio on during the ride.  Multiple drivers.  Need to provide a stool to help getting on the bus.

review.name: Great trip
review.reviewBody: Great overview of the city. Good commentary, easy to hear. You get good information about the city and the stops are well placed

review.name: Fa schiffo
review.reviewBody: Al porto ti vendono il giro dicendo che passa un autobus ogni 30 minuti,nn e vero niente e quando provi a chiedere info al personale di accoglienza della fermata,sui tempi gli orari ecc ti dicono di parlare con l autista,l autista straniero che nn capisce una mazza di italiano ti rimanda dall' altro e viceversa,però i soldi dagli italiani li prendono.rspetienzs pessima per nn parlare della sporcizia sui pullman auricolari che nn funzionano,e molta precarietà sulla manutenzione degli stessi tenendo conto che viaggiano sempre s pieno carico (di persone)

review.name: To expensive for what you get
review.reviewBody: I am a big Fan of hoho tours and whenever I am visiting a city that offers the tour, I am taking it. Seattle has the most expensive tour I think I have ever taken. And it takes you just around the center. You can actually walk it if you bring some time. I still had to walk alot, since e.g. the Jimmy Hendrix Statue is not included. The explanations are only in English over the general PA system of the bus. Sometime it was difficult to understand. It's the first hoho tour I did where you could not chose a language over headphones. I thought that was a standard. The drivers don't want to see your ticket at no point. I had a couple next to me talking about making the tour without ticket. That is not cool. Unfortunately I felt like the tour is a waste of money. Better to explore Seattle by foot and use the money for the entrance to some also very expensive tourist attractions.

review.name: Overpriced bus ride
review.reviewBody: Seattle was one of our stops on a long road trip across the country. Only had a day to spend in Seattle. I got the tickets on Groupon and saved 40.00 for 2 of us.  So happy I did that because it definitely isn’t worth full price.  This is basically an over priced bus ride. Not a lot of history about Seattle, but it is a hop on off bus. Then to top it off they say a bus comes around every 30 minutes or so but it’s more like 45 minutes to an hour. If you basically just want to go along to the different places along the water and don’t want to walk there is a FREE trolley. Wish we would have known that before hand.

review.name: Good for quick highlights
review.reviewBody: It was good. The tour by Tours Northwest was much more informative. That said, this was good if you just want a quick high level overview of the city and the main tourist attractions. The bus that is open on top was pretty old and run down.

itemListElement.name: Seattle MTB Tour: Beginner to Advanced

name: Seattle MTB Tour: Beginner to Advanced
description: The Beginner – Advanced days are designated for new or casual adventurer.  This is a great option for anyone who is curious about mountain biking or interested in learning basic mountain biking skills or working on developing enhanced biking skills. This tour option would also work great for a ride with a group of friends with a variety of skill levels.

review.name: Awesome day in the saddle
review.reviewBody: Pickup, guide expertise, bike and such were all excellent. Let's talks about the fun part. My guide Eric synced with the type of trials  and pace I wanted to do from the start. We started the morning at Raging River, flowy trials and ended the day at Tiger Mountain, much more technical.  He was was very good at letting me know what to expect, allowing me to ride at my capabilities  I have been mountain biking for 25 years and this was the most fun I have had.

review.name: Outstanding Overall Experience - A+++
review.reviewBody:
My favorite part of this experience was the variety of trails.  I ride advanced and I was very impressed with the quality of the trails design/flow and obstacles.

That said, I've never ridden Seattle.  I only had limited time and I didn't want to waste any time figuring out routes on my own and that's when I started looking for a guide.  I spoke with and ended up riding with Matt Paul.  Matt is an excellent guide and made this experience extraordinary from a client perspective.  

He was timely for pickup, hospitable and what I REALLY appreciated was that he drove safely and prioritized.  This is very important to me being from a small town and not being used to the city traffic, I felt very comfortable as a passenger. 

Before we rode, Matt added he is certified in first aid and about trail etiquette and anything we should keep in mind, while riding. Again, from a rider/client perspective I appreciated knowing we were out with someone who knows the area fluently and if the situation arose, could help and get help. 

On the trail, Matt gave trail info, tips on riding direction, and best routes and also offered riding style and technique tips.

Between rides Matt loaded/unloaded and broke down and set up bikes and spent time fine tuning sag/ suspension so that the riders would get the full benefit of the bikes they were riding.  

At the end of the day I was more than satisified with the amount of riding we had done and I got exactly what I wanted - A great guide, who seems like a really good person in general who observed and then showed me the way to the trails that best suited my riding style.  

Outstanding overall experience.  Thank you Matt and thank you Seattle Mountain Bike Tours!

review.name: Best Birthday Present
review.reviewBody: For my birthday, my wife purchased an MTB excursion gift certificate with Seattle MTB. Matt coached me on weight distribution, turning and riding techniques. He also introduced me to several new trails along I-90 near Snoqualmie and North Bend. We spent the day shredding Raging River and Tiger Mountain - super fun!

review.name: Great outdoor experience!
review.reviewBody:
The all included experience makes it easy.. From pickup at the hotel downtown to bike preparatuon and finally the recommandations on the trails!
Specially appreciated the high quality bikes, well adaptated by our guide Erik. Then Erik shared with us tips and trick on the trails. As a European discovering this region and the way MTB is practiced here, it was a great day

review.name: Perfect way to spend a day
review.reviewBody: I'm a little delayed with my review, but I'm still stoked about my day with Seattle Mountain Bike Tours - they absolutely exceeded my expectations! Since I was visiting from out of town and didn't have my bike or access to a car, the convenience of this service was a necessity. Matt started the trip by getting an idea of my skill level and then we hit the trails. He did a great job of communicating what trail options we had and what to expect on those trails. The day was an absolute blast and completely catered to my riding level. They really did provide great service from the amazing Liv rental bike, to Matt having all the snacks and equipment we might need on the trail, to the provided meals, and the transportation from pick-up to drop-off. Matt was extremely encouraging and made the day super fun! He even indulged my creative side and took some posed (and unposed) photos! I would definitely recommend Seattle Mountain Bike Tours and would love to ride with them again if I'm ever back in Seattle!

review.name: Best way to ride when visiting
review.reviewBody: I was visiting Seattle for a conference and I really wanted to try out mountain biking in the pacific northwest. I knew it would be totally unique. I researched Seattle Mountain Bike Tours and found numerous 5 star reviews so I reached out. They went out of their way to make sure I had the best trip possible. They offer transportation to and from, awesome bikes, equipment, snacks water, and a great guide. My guide Ashley was outstanding. She made sure she found the trails that I was looking for. They have options for any skill level. You can be a total beginner, a wild jumper, a hard core downhiller if the trails exist in the Area they will take you there. Yes the trails around Seattle are amazing. It was truly a wonderful experience. The ride is super affordable the service is top notch. They take away any reason not to go. Definitely book a tour you won't regret it.

review.name: Awesome day of riding
review.reviewBody: Super happy I spent my day doing this tour. The guide, Nolan, was super cool and accommodating. The bike they lend you is quality, lunch in town was awesome and the expierence was great.

review.name: Fun Rides - Great Guides
review.reviewBody: I had a fantastic time riding some amazing trails.  Two days of riding multiple locations with fantastic trails.   My guides were terrific and offered everything - pointers, lunch, and good stories.  Pick-up and drop-off at the hotel was seamless and bikes were full carbon.   Thanks Matt, Erik, and John!

review.name: Rails Now Trails
review.reviewBody: Awesome re-purposing of old timber RR line masterfully pieced together with local attractions by Owner Matt Paul and Super Guide Ashley Beimert.  What a reunion we had in large part thanks to the SMBT gang.

review.name: Incredible ride with an outstanding guide
review.reviewBody: I did a day-long ride with guide Nolan on Saturday, August 11 in Snoqualmie.  I am an east coast singletrack rider and this was my first ride in the PacNW.  After picking me up at my hotel in Seattle, we drove to Raging River State Forest.  Nolan made sure the Giant (Anthem, I believe) was properly set up for me, including shock pressure, adjustments to brake angle and reach, and swapping the saddle.  The ride started with a lengthy climb up the mountain and we rode the 18 mile lollipop loop.  Nolan set a strong climbing pace, but he made sure he didn't drop me, and we definitely earned our turns.  The ride down was mostly bermed and flowy until we reached "No Service," where it became steeper with ruts and roots.  Very challenging and exhilarating, especially at speed.  The stats: 18.5 miles, 3,884' vertical.  We stopped for a burrito for lunch and some recovery.  The afternoon ride was at Tiger Mountain where we rode another 6.5 miles with 1275' vert.  I chose to do a shorter ride, Nolan was game for anything I wanted to do.  The climbs were long, but the grades were manageable and everything was rideable.  We had another great ride back down, going through clearings and into thick, dark second growth forests. The bike was great, and Nolan's guidance and knowledge of the trials were priceless!  I highly recommend.
